Review.Titre: DO NOT TRUST REVIEWS AFTER ONLY 5 TIMES USED THE WATCH WONT TURN ON
Review.Contenu: All of the reviews are after immediately receiving the watch. Which at first it was great. I bought this watch 13 months ago with a 1 year warranty. So of course I am ONE month over the extended warranty. My son has only used this watch FIVE times on field trips. The watch is in excellent condition zero damage. It will not turn on. I charged it for an hour tried different outlets and charging bases and still nothing. I am reading this is a common issue and that’s why they have it on their FAQ and for returns. For the price I should definitely get more then 5 uses out of it. He is going on a trip today and I had planned on him wearing it and now we’re stuck with nothing.

I tried to get some help from customer support, but it didn't work. I got tired of making something that expensive work, and in the end, I returned the product.However, along with the product itself, you need to buy a monthly plan, and that is fine. The thing is, if you decide to return the product, remember to cancel that plan. It has been showing on my account for the last four months, and when I tried to dispute it, the merchant replied that I signed the terms and conditions.That is very convenient; if you disagree with the terms and conditions, you can't use the product, right? 😊😆 Anyways, beware of these merchant tricks.

Review.Titre: I ordered the watch as a gift
Review.Contenu: I ordered the watch as a gift, chatted with customer service online, and was told that if I paid for overnight it would arrive by the next day. I was called a couple of hours later and was told that it did not ship in time and would arrive the second day. It did arrive and would not activate. I was told to wait until the morning which I did. It did not activate by next morning, now 3 days behind on gift giving, and was told to call back at 5 if it did not activate. It did not activate and I was told to wait until the next morning, which I did and it still did not activate. I told the rep that I no longer wanted the phone. I was ultimately refunded everything, including the overnight shipping costs. I liked the concept of the watch but never got it to work. On a side note, the size of the watch was rather large. I ended up buying an Apple Watch SE which activated within a few minutes.

I have edited my review down to 1 star as the app is not notifying me of texts/communication from my son. I have always had the appropriate settings on my Android that TickTalk referenced in communication on February 16, 2023 (I've had these settings correct on my phone since December 2022). I notified TickTalk of this issue on January 31, 2023. They refused to help me as I couldn't take a video of my phone not getting notified from the watch.  I emailed again a week later as the issue was continuing. Since then I've had 53 emails back and forth with Support. Now they are asking for screenshots of the phone not having notifications. I have provided screenshots and a video of the app not notifying. I have provided all information from my phone and the watch and they ignore my requests for a resolution date. I am thoroughly disappointed in TickTalk - the very reason for the watch is to be able to communicate with a child. I can't communicate with them unless I refresh the app every hour to make sure I didn't miss a message.  Support has been completely unhelpful and the watch itself is a timekeeper at this point.

Activated February 28th still not service on the watch. I might just return it. I like the concept but to be charged for my service I paid March 1st and I still don’t have the service for my son. Besides him being on wifi. Could be better for the price.

Review.Titre: was so hopeful, but so disappointed
Review.Contenu: was so hopeful, but this is the most disappointed I’ve been with a product in a long time. In the first month there were numerous times the watch was suddenly offline, would not turn on for days at a time, or needed the SIM card to be reinserted suddenly.I bought the warranty to be safe. On day 38 the watch would not turn on, would not respond to charge, nothing. At this point, I just want a return because it has failed me and my kid in too many important moments, once where he was hurt and couldn’t call me, and had to run home sobbing. They said I’m outside my return window and gave me some (seemingly bogus and cumbersome) instructions as to “reboot” which did not work. It’s been 30-some days and the watch has failed in MULTIPLE different ways, at least 5-7 times (which is a lot since it’s only worn after school on some days) and now it is completely dead. Useless. The gps was never helpful and often times just reported to the nearest cell tower, which of course is not helpful. For a $200 product that fails completely on day 38… or even in the first year! and the customer service to basically say, woops, sorry!, that seems like a scam to me, so without warranty, I can only imagine how many completely out of luck with a bad product and no remedy. Hopefully, they honor the warranty at least for a replacement, but I honestly would feel bad even selling this to another parent. I’m bummed, but if they would honor my return (for my watch under warranty), I would feel like they were at least trying to service their customers.

I bought this watch for my 9 year old son. He is a typical boy and he rides his quad and dirt bike. This watch was specifically to keep track of him. First he went trailing and of course he had no service at all. So I couldn’t track him. He wore the watch for a couple of weeks and both chargers ended up breaking. We then realized that we needed to move him to a different device since it was accurate and he started to hate it. I reached out to customer service and they said yes return it for a refund. I sent everything back except one charger because we threw it away. The other charger I sent back even though it was broken also. I sent back the watch, which worked just fine when we sent it back. I also sent the charms and everything that came with our order. Customer Service told me they cant send me a refund because the watch was damaged. I know that watch worked when I sent it. I personally powered it off when returning it. However this was supposed to be a 100% money back guarantee and a $30 fee for damaged product…. Which the chargers were damaged. They use their terms lightly. 100% money back guarantee is a fraud. This is a KIDS watch. It wont look perfect if a child had worn it. I wont recommend this product to anyone. I have a younger child that will not be getting one these either. Im extremely disappointed about how they handled this… and NO I dont want a replacement. This product ended up not working out and not being durable.

Review.Titre: Terrible Quality and Poor Customer Service
Review.Contenu: Summary of a long review: if you are outside of the US, don't buy from them. The bands broke within a couple of months, and they will not honor their warranty for international buyers who purchased from Amazon, despite the stated warranty policy on their own website. The current state of the product: my defective watch is still with them, and they still insist on charging me $100 to replace it. I am still in the middle of frustrating email exchanges with their customer support. Parents, if you don't want to be in my shoes and are looking for peace of mind, take your business elsewhere.I will keep this updated until it is resolved, and the detail is as follows.--------------------------------------2nd Update (2023-09-16). From the reply below and my communication with their support, at least they implicitly walked back the claim that those purchased from Amazon are used ones. That's good to know.Now, the argument has changed: their warranty does not cover those purchased from Amazon. This is interesting because their own website stated, which I quote here, exactly the opposite: "TickTalk smartwatches purchased from authorized third-party retailers, including Amazon and/or Walmart, are eligible for our 1-Year Limited Warranty." And this one-year limited warranty also extends to international buyers, as per their website: "For international customers, you are responsible for any shipping fees, duties, and/or taxes associated with warranty claim." Indeed, they followed this clause to the letter, so that I paid out of my pocket to ship the defective watch back to them (see my original review).Last issue: are the broken bands covered under limited warranty? My watch was purchased in Dec 2022, during the defective holiday batch. It falls into the category of "basic hardware defect in workmanship." On their own Facebook community page, the company announcement dated May 5th, 2023 also stated the limited warranty covers the broken bands in the affected batches, and their policy is to offer a free replacement. So my first question is, why am I charged $100 to repair a watch with a basic hardware defect covered under a limited warranty?My second question is, why does a customer here, a frustrated parent, need to spend so much time writing countless emails to communicate with a company about their own defective product? How far are they willing to go to avoid taking responsibility for their own defective products? This is pretty ironic for a product advertised to offer peace of mind for parents. I am documenting all these back-and-forths with them to show how much frustration a customer needs to go through to cover their basic rights. I hope the other parents do not need to go through the same and can find their peace of mind from some other companies.I am eager to see their reply to my points above.--------------------------------------First update (2023-09-13): Now the support team tells me that this watch from Amazon is not new but a used one, so they don't have any liability to repair or replace it. They inferred that my watch must be used because it is sold at a discount. My purchase price tag is around USD 200, which is higher than the price on their website. The Amazon receipt also states that this is a new product. I am no longer angry, I am now just curious to see how far they will go to avoid honoring their warranty. For any parents watching this, I will keep you posted.--------------------------------------The original review:In short, if you live outside the US, don't buy from them. The watch broke within a few months; they do not cover return shipping, and eventually, they charged me $100 to replace their faulty watch while all within the warranty period. The details are as follows:After a couple of months of everyday use, one band broke. At the time, we thought, fine, it is a kid's watch, and it breaks. We glued it back, and after another month, the other band also broke. In the meantime, the speaker sometimes works and sometimes does not. The watch also fails to charge occasionally due to a poorly designed magnetic charger.After the second band broke, we Googled online and discovered this is a common defect of their watches. We contacted customer service to ask for a replacement. To add icings on the top, they refuse to provide free shipping for customers outside of the US. Ultimately, we have to pay to return their defective watch.This is absolutely the last time that I purchase from them.

Review.Titre: ABSOLUTE JUNK AND PRODUCT and EVEN WORSE COMPANY!
Review.Contenu: Update to Response: Your reply lets EVERYONE know how much of a Dishonest company you are. Watch is past the 30 day return window and Amazon wants to charge a $40 restocking fee to return you DEFECTIVE device. But you know that!!------------If you are buying this to keep tabs on your Childs location in case of emergency. DO NOT BUY!If you are buying this watch so your child can reach you in an EMERGENCY. DO NOT BUY!If you want your child just to be able to tell time buy them $20 kids watch.If you are buying this because your kids are tech savvy and like playing with devices like this. DO NOT BUY!After some company research it appears this company... "TICKTALK TECH" was operating under TICKTALK, INC and was suspended by the State of California so as a work around they registered the same company under a slightly different name to get around their state suspension. Suspended - FTB is the official Status!What does FTB suspended status mean?A business entity is typically suspended, or forfeited, by Franchise Tax Board (FTB) for failure to meet its tax requirements, such as File a state tax return. Pay. Taxes.Read on to find out why all this is relevant to my review...I thought for the price I was buying a product I could rely on to track my 9-year-olds location. As a Parent and the current state of our country with the things going on at schools. My wife and I wanted a means to contact our son and for he to be able to contact us in Emergency. I as a parent was really sold on the GPS tracking. Come to find out the GPS tracking NEVER and I mean NEVER works. It is either COMPLETY inaccurate or never works. Will say offline all the time. If you go to their FB page, you can see MANY if not MOST complaining about the same thing.The company will give you a bunch of bogus excuses and bogus remedies. Things like poor reception and poor battery life or just blame your kid themselves. My son charges his watch EVERYDAY after school so always very well charged when he is wearing it. As for reception well the fence in my backyard literally separates our property from my son’s school. At home great reception and at school the same as at home as it is less than 100 yards away from my backdoor. Both at home and at school the GPS never puts him remotely close to wear he is REALLY at. Sometimes it’s so bad it has him across town MILES away! Now let’s get to the company. A couple months ago the operating system of the watch was sent an update with Bricked the watch. Meaning it became frozen and unresponsive and stuck on startup screen!I called the company and thought some simple trouble shooting would fix it. Nope! Instead, I was basically told we are aware of the DEFECT, and you must send it back. This of course was after 30 minutes of back and forth and my common sense blowing their excuses out of the water. I then stated I would be leaving BBB and States attorney complaints. Now generally when it gets to this point with a BAD company, they will then try to do the RIGHT thing. NOPE not this company. Instead, I was told by the Manager I was threating her personally and was abruptly hung up. I filled out the warrant form sent it back and waited two weeks to get it back. Upon arrival they forgot to put the sim card door in the return box. So, they sent me two in the mail. Crazy thing is they were the wrong size. I then had to wait another week to get the right size. Now today my son comes home from school his watch is flashing all types of colors and not working AGAIN.Turns out another update was sent to watch while he was at school, and it bricked the watch AGAIN. So, I call again. It appears they are aware of this DEFECT and their ONLY solution is every time the watch is updated over the 5g network and not Wi-Fi this is likely to happen. So, you then must let the watch sit a couple days, so the battery drains and the watch turn off. This is their fix. Not to recall and fix their defective product.I was told we must monitor our kids and make sure they only try to update the watch when they are being supervised by an adult to be sure the watch is on WI-FI. As a Parent we all know, best of luck with that with how savvy our kids are with electronics today. I told the Manager this is not a solution and I need either new updated version of the watch or a REFUND. I was essentially in not so many words told to go pound sand. I was then asked by the MANAGER if I am an UNHAPPY person? She asked are you married. What makes you suck and unhappy person? Now normally this would seem INSANE to come from a manager of a company to a paying customer dealing with a DEFECTIVE product. But since being hung up and told I was threatening the person last time when I mentioned BBB and States attorney complaints. This surprising did not shock me!So, as of now I am stuck with an OVERPICED toy that will need to trouble shoot my kids watch after every update and not know where my kid is at.

I ordered on the 19th of November.  The shipping was created and I have YET to receive the watch.  It was supposed to be here by the 24th and it is currently the 29th.  My sons birthday is tomorrow and now it's completely ruined.  I saved up for this watch.  For some 149$ isnt alot but for our household it is alot! I cant afford to buy him anything else now.  I'm writing this in tears.

When a call is received it comes up as private caller. My child will not answer a call without knowing who it is. Used online support to try and figure things out but didn’t get any resolve. They had to let me go after nearly two hours because their shift was over. Not a good first impression of customer service when the product isn’t working. Frustrating to say the least.

Review.Contenu: I ordered this for my 8yo daughter. The watch does not work. I am now waiting on someone to email me about an exchange/return/refund. Due to not hearing from anyone yet, I am not very impressed with this product or its customer service.

Let’s try again I don’t think I’m being heard. The ONLY character you have to send through text message other than the emoji face is a devil. An ENTIRE line, 1/5, of your chums is a devil. kids may like the devil icon because they are more animated, please do not respond with there are five options.Psychologically the devil icon is associated with mischievousness and chaos.For anybody reading this there is no other additional option in the text for kids to use other than a devil. And no I am not Christian I just do not like being fed any agenda. Are you a luciferin company?

Review.Titre: My package was lost and I am still…
Review.Contenu: My package was lost and I am still waiting for a refund. I’ve reached out to customer support and filed a missing package case with USPS. Didn’t even get a chance to get the watch but still being charged for it. Still waiting for a refund.

The watch came defected. Cannot be charged. Cannot start. The product arrived in time for christmas but i cannot gift to my son on time. He is very upset. Support team and staff are helpful and response is quick.

The functionality was misrepresented.  You can’t text without the app, the watch can’t find a network and the gps falsely shows my daughter in Virginia but we live in California.  Waste of money and poor customer service.

I am extremely disappointed in the functionality.  While some of the features work, others do not.  The tracking was most important to me, but that is available on all the kid watched (T-Mobile Sync, Verizon Gizmon, Angel, etc.).  My kids were very interested in the step tracking so they could have competitions with their friends.  Tick Talk should NOT advertise that they offer step tracking.  What they have is a movement tracker.  The steps are WAY off.  I reached out on this and was told "if the hand is shaken it may be counted as a step".  These are kids, they are always moving.  It was giving my son steps as we were sitting in the car.  For a $200 watch I'm extremely disappointed this is not accurate and even more disappointed that the company is falsely advertising this is a feature they offer.

Review.Titre: Terrible customer service. No one responds to calls emails or chat.

Completely disappointed.  Got the watch, set it all up, got the cell service added contacts, everything and now the piece of crap won't even charge, I have 2 chargers neither work...  complete trash!

The proces to get this watch and get it working has been ridiculous! I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS WATCH OR COMPANY OR RED POCKET! I bought this for my 5 year old son mostly for the video chat, tracking, and music features. After a month dealing with the service company to get it turned on, the watch said it was "overheating" anytime we used these features and would get very hot. Obviously I don't want my son wearing something on his wrist that is overheating and extremely hot and could burn him. After multiple phone calls and troubleshooting and it still not working properly I was over it. Now they're saying it's too late to get a refund. I want my money back especially after all this wasted time and frustration. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT OR COMPANY!

Review.Titre: Watch band didn’t last a week
Review.Contenu: The Tick Talk 4 watch is fine but the band broke within a week of giving this to my son. One week. I superglued it and then it broke in another spot. I called customer support. They told me I have to send the entire watch back so they can determine if the band can be replaced. If it can, they will. If it can’t they’ll replace the watch for $100. WTH???? You mean this isn’t covered by the warranty? Apparently not. They told me I can buy the extended warranty. How can a watch band not be replaceable? If the thing fails immediately after purchase they should stand behind it. Period. This is less than 10 days old. Apparently the warranty that comes with the watch is meaningless. So now I have to decide whether to send it back and hope they deem it replaceable or whether to try to superglue this brand new watch back together so my son can continue to use it. My son has not been hard on this watch. He just wears it while going about his normal business. Without a functioning band the watch is nearly useless.

Review.Titre: We purchased this watch for our son for…
Review.Contenu: We purchased this watch for our son for his 7th birthday. First off, it did arrive on time. Unfortunately the included SIM card was defective out of the box. After no useful help or explanation from TickTalk’s service provider, we took the watch to our cellular provider and had a new line added to our plan. Three days later, both cameras have moisture under lenses and watch will not function. He has not been near any water while wearing it but had spent most of the day before outside in high humidity weather. When we contacted tech support, they stated rudely that they could not do anything as they are to busy with other customers. They did say that they could do a onetime replacement but could not give a refund due to water damage not being covered by warranty. We plead our case to them that normal moisture from a child’s rust should not constitute water damage and that we wanted a refund. Their response was simply “No”. I would not recommend this product to anyone living in the southern area of the United States.

I’m a first time customer from abroad and have just purchased the TickTalk 3 watch (end of November 2020).Despite my repeated emails, TickTalk Team completely ignored, neglected and failed to respond.TickTalk Team has no courtesy at all to at least respond or reply to my queries/follow up emails -It appears that TickTalk fails and refuses to honour what they had promised/represented to me, to deliver to me a free wrist band and hence completely ignored all my follow-up emails.If TickTalk company is incapable of delivering its promise/representation to send me (its customer) a free wrist band, then why made such a promise/representation in the first place if it cannot honour?   Don’t CHEAT the customer!Surprisingly, TickTalk Team is incapable of  handling such a mere wrist band issue and failed to build its customer’s trust from a first time customer abroad like me.Perhaps that’s how TickTalk is running its business, giving FALSE promise/representation to its customers from abroad as they know they can easily get away with.Truly disappointed and regret for shopping with TickTalk.

I loved the 3. Great watch with great connectivity. The 4!!! What the hell happened. The watch has a few apps, and they crash. Good luck playing music, I was never able to get it to work. ALSO I bought the watch to call my kid. Guess what? The new watch was downgraded for connectivity. My favorite gripe, When a kid doesn't answer the phone, you can't leave a message because the kid hasn't set up voicemail. But guess what? There IS no voicemail. The kid will never be able to set it up. Why would you do this? What is the point? just say, there is no way to leave a voice mail message- goodbye. I wanted this to work sooo much. The previous one was great, but I didn't get a full year out of it, doubt I'ld get a year out of a watch that doesn't really work right out of the gate. Why does the watch disconnect from the wifi so frequently? Why does the music app not work? Why am I not able to call my kid in the Bay Area with fabulous reception?. Great idea- but it got too clunky and non functional. The customer service is fabulous! Thats the other part that pisses me off, They care about their customers and I wanted to be one. Just need a watch that does what you claim it does. Call me as most reviews are fake. Tony 6504443271

Hard to use, huge, and useless FaceTalk
Review.Contenu: This comes with no instruction manual. We’d love to know what the different symbols on the watch mean. We couldn’t get the tracking feature on the watch to work. After a lot of time on YouTube, we figure it out. Also, the FaceTalk feature is nearly useless. It would have been nice to know ahead of time that you can only use FaceTalk for 3 minutes before the watch overheats. I sincerely regret this decision and wish we would have just gone with the Gabb watch. It’s more popular for a reason. Also, like other reviewers said, this watch is very large and clunky.

Review.Titre: GPS Tracking function is working fine…
Review.Contenu: GPS Tracking function is working fine and it does its job. Parental control interface is easy to use. Shortcut call icons to parents is good idea. Voice call works just fine too.FaceTalk used to work when I first received it but now it stops working on wireless network and WI-FI without video. In addition, during audio call (not phone) using data, I cannot hear anything from the watch. I tried to reset the watch and it still did not work. Also tried firmware/apps update but it’s not required so all software should be up-to-date.When sweeping the screen, it’s insensitive and the user often needs to try several times to switch to other screen pages. When pressing on the screen, the touch-screen is overly sensitive and often gets one-level down to the function interface.
Watch doesn't refresh signal.

Watch itself worked ok besides not being able to hear them to good at times unless they hold the watch close to the face. Also the gps is way off it shows my kid is on the other side of town at times when I know he isn't. Even connected to his school wifi it says he is down the road. For a watch just for calling it works good but for gps your better off looking for something else. I am very un happy with the watch mainly because I mainly bought it for gps tracking to know where my kids is but it don't do that. The plus side is I can call him or voice message him anytime but that's about all the watch is good for I'm very unsatisfied with the watch don't waste your money if you plan on using the gps tracker! If just for talking it works ok but could use a little better speaker to be able to hear them better

The concept is great, the watch functions well. The issue is the GPS. The watch will be in the other room of the house and when checking the location it will show the watch is 50+ miles away. This happens daily. The main purpose of it is to keep watch on my child that is learning responsibility. I've had to completely reset and repair the watch to my phone on 2 occasions (I've had the watch for 5 days.)

We just activated TickTalk 4.  The GPS initially told me the watch was across the street.  Now, is says it’s 45 minutes away even though it’s charging in my kitchen.  It worked great for phone calls to child but not worth the price tag to be that inaccurate on the GPS.

We received our TickTalk 4 watch on 2/23/23, and attempted to set up a TickTalk Wireless account with our AT&T SIM card.  As of today, that account is still “pending” due to a technical issue on AT&T’s end.  While I appreciate this may be out of TickTalk’s control, there could have been measures taken at the onset of AT&T’s issues by communicating to your customers at the point of carrier selection and only allowing T-Mobile SIM cards until AT&T’s issue was resolved.  So after nearly a week, I have a $200 watch that is useless to me and my child; this certainly does not meet my expectations.  I did have positive email interaction with TickTalk’s customer service in 2/24/23, but beyond that there’s been no communication as to the status of AT&T’s issue, nor any other option provided to me other than to wait.

Review.Titre: Don’t make excuses you can’t handle.
Review.Contenu: When adding the watch to the cart. Along with getting ready to make the purchase. No where did it stated it would be back ordered. I had emailed the company and the CS at that time wanted to make excuses and screen shot an image about the back order date. Keep in mind she did this while emailing back and forth. So how does that solve my answer at the time I made my purchase.

The gps isn’t always accurate.  At one point it said my son was in Florida (he was at school in Illinois) and the other time he wore it he said he was still at the roller rink and he had just rang our doorbell.  It’s been disappointing so far.

There's a couple things. The website wasn't working when I went to activate the watch. Called customer service and they're zero help. Just told me to wait for awhile and try again. Then, the info about the watch is misleading. It says unlimited calls and texts, but it can only text through their app. I'm the admin so I have the app, but no one else we know does. Same for video calls. So basically, it's just a watch that can call the contacts I've approved. No one else is going to download the app just to be able to message and video call with my kid.

Review.Titre: We have had it for a couple of days
Review.Contenu: We have had it for a couple of days, it says it’s supposed to be user friendly but it’s annoying how everyone has to download the app to talk to the child. It is hard to press at times. It has no keypad for some stuff.

I am very disappointed with the quality of the Tick Talk watch. It was replaced under warranty and has since broken again, but cannot be replaced under warranty. We have also had to replace the SIM card multiple times from normal wear.

Review.Titre: I bought two of these for my kids and…
Review.Contenu: I bought two of these for my kids and neither one tracks them accurately. The tracking shows them in another state or city. Emailed customer service and have heard nothing.

-2 Stars for Setup. No mention of a known minor manufacturing defect that cost over 5hrs working with the SIM provider, when a note or acknowledgement would have taken 5 mins to fix.Really disappointed so far.EDIT: in response to reply: This has nothing to do with RedPocket, but is a result of a bad installation of the dummy SIM coming from the Watch's factory. One that the your CS-agent, knew immediately how to fix (because they had clearly done it multiple times already) but hadn't been surfaced externally in any way.

The watch gets warm when used which makes me feel it is not safe. The location is not accurate. Messaging can only be done though the app which is frustrating. The child can not type any texts and needs WiFi for texting. I was extremely disappointed for the amount of money I spent on this product. I would not recommend it.

Review.Titre: Watch not working the way it should.
Review.Contenu: While the purchasing experience was fine and received the watch in a timely manner the setting up was very frustrating and it still is not working the way it should.  95% of the time it is telling me its offline and I would have thought the battery would last longer.  On a side note I have not given upon the watch I just need time to call the help line to see if they can possibly help with the issues I am having .

Sent watch back for replacement recently. Received message from shipper that watch was received 2 messages to Support Team to confirm that it was received and cant get anyone to respond. Very bad customer service. Communication is a very important part of customer service

the watch seems to be good, but the battery can’t stand more than 8 hours in standby mode, it’s a real issue , if the kid take it to the school, he should take the cable with him and look where to plug his watch !!!!

Slow / unhelpful responses to emails, no assurance of help even though the watch was defective. Get the impression international customers do not matter to this company. Have had to but a second watch just to get the replacement sooner.

Received watch.  DOA.  Elongated and clunky process to deal with return and replacement.  Will see how replacement does.  DOA devices always an indication of poor production and fulfillment QC.  Ineffective support experiences an indication of poor CX commitment.

Review.Titre: When I first bought my daughter the…
Review.Contenu: When I first bought my daughter the tick talk 3 I was very pleased and happy with the watch and all the features, we had that watch for about 6 years then gave it to my younger daughter and decided to upgrade it for the tick talk 4 since we were pleased with the service and all its features then shortly after paying 189 plus tax for the upgraded version and giving to my daughter for Christmas it gets stolen from her backpack(yes it should have been on her but she's 7 and had to take it off in class) I contacted tick talk got little to no help locating the watch and told me I had to purchase another one and only got a small discount for the new one. The customer service and lack of sympathy or warranty on a watch I had just bought really seemed like a rip off of my hard earned money.

Unreliable location tracking. Tried two different sim cards still the same results. Contact customer support for assistance but no resolution. Other features works fine. If location tracking is important for you then look for other options.

Review.Titre: Issues with accurate location and short…
Review.Contenu: Issues with accurate location and short battery life. Upgraded to tick talk 4 hoping for improved battery life which is stated by sales rep and website to be 100 hours but it’s 100 hours in standby/airplane mode which was divulged after purchase. The watch during normal use still only provides 4 to 6 hours of battery life. In addition I have 2 watches and only 1 tracks the accurate location in real time the other lags 3 to 5 miles on a trip behind if it even registers in close proximity. Also location is not concise as the tt2 e.g. tt2 showed kids in home now watches show they are in strip mall parking lot 500 feet away. Disappointed in the upgrade and marketing tactics are below board

Review.Titre: We ordered a replacement when the first…

Review.Contenu: It always seems to be offline. When it works it’s great, but more often than not, it shows as offline and defeats the purpose of the phone.

Still waiting to receive watch. Cant review something I am still waiting to get. FedEx has changed the date 3 times since address was changed.
For Canadian buyers you should have a custom process for how to activate as well as customs clearance in the order process.

Review.Titre: OK product, Not very good service
Review.Contenu: I purchased 2 watch bundles during the Kickstarter campaign.  Communication was good and received the items, as expected.  Watch is a little bulky but works pretty well.  The kids like them.  Within a month, the watch band broke on 1 watch.  The way the band connects to the body is a little odd; it can't be laid flat and it's not obvious if you can even replace the band.  I don't think it's a very good design.  On a previous kids' smartwatch we replaced the band several times and never had an issue.  In this case, the connection point broke into pieces, not just the band or pin.  I contacted TickTalk about a replacement.  It has been almost 3 weeks and I still don't have a replacement; I'm told it has shipped.  Every email would go 1-2 days before getting a response.  I tried the chat on the site with no response.  I was able to talk to a person when I called.   Overall, extremely disappointed in the service.  This was a very simple transaction; most companies could have handled it in a couple of days.  Waiting days for responses to email simply isn't acceptable.
Gets hot when in use. GPS not accurate in real-time.
the service seems fine, but is not accurate with tracking my son.

It would be perfect if it had a gps fence to alert me if my child is outside a set perimeter...like if some kidnapped my kiddo from school or yard.Also, if the GPS location was better with wifi. In my house wifi, the watch shows that the kiddo is 2 miles away.Would it hurt to make the task alarms more customizable. Why can't I customize specific task labels or for calendar reminders?

Review.Titre: Charged me twice otherwise was simple

Review.Contenu: Still more progress need to be made regarding 2 way communication but it is fineNThe location tracer is not so quick and accurate but ok than other productsTickTalk please call me I have more suggestions to makeRegardsUsman+966503150799

The watch is generally pretty good, however, it does have it's limitations.  A QR code to fill out information on a website would be better than using the extremely small alphabet on the screen.  The location doesn't always update easily.  It's cumbersome to get grandparents connected to the watch, however, once it's done everything is good.  All said, I like the watch, but it just has a few small things I think could be better.

Review.Titre: I like this watch for more reasons than…
Review.Contenu: I like this watch for more reasons than I dislike it. The designed purpose of this watch is 100% achieved. It has served me well as an assistive health device for my 7-year-old who has a medical condition. I however didn't like the fact that the watch didn't survive a year of usage. The wristband broke off completely. Even though there is a warranty for the watch, I am being asked for a review, in exchange for a $100 fee waiver for the watch replacement.

Review.Titre: Video call is not working with our wifi…
Review.Contenu: Video call is not working with our wifi and does not show the location immediately and it takes about few minutes to update. Sometimes I have to re open the app then it shows

TickTalk 4 watch’s are awesome but they advertise them to be waterproof which they are not.  Customer service even said it on the phone.  They are ok to have on in like a drizzle rain but that’s about it. This was a huge reason why I purchased 2 of these and now after 1 got ruined due to water damage, I’m being told they actually aren’t waterproof.  For the record ticktalk did replace it free of charge which was great, but I was still down a watch for 2 weeks and it’ll probably just happen again since ya know, they’re kids..

Review.Titre: I like the remote call feature that…
Review.Contenu: I like the remote call feature that allows me to listen in without my child knowing, the ability to disable the watch being powered off or data being turned of by the watch, and the reminders setting. So far the gps service is not as accurate as I would like but I did just contact customer service and they said they will basically reboot it and to test it out again in 24hours so fingers crossed that resolved things...it was showing my child being in California when she was right next to me in GEORGIA! Will follow up again after more time passes.

I recently purchased the power base charger for my daughter’s watch. The power base charger worked well, but I had to find the correct USB adapter. It could have charged the watch faster if it had been included with the power base charger—other than that, I am pleased with my purchase so far. I also purchased the single wire charger it also came without the USB adapter. I also notice this particular charges stop working quickly in comparison to my cellphone charger. This will be the first charger I have purchased since buying the watch. I have not had the watch for an entire year yet, but the charger completely stopped charging. I bought the power base hoping it would last longer than the wired charger.

My son got this watch for Christmas. Love a lot of the settings. He likes the iheart radio app, control over contacts, can see all messages they receive, drop in feature is amazing. However the gps isn’t as precise as I was hoping for he can be across the street and 2/3 houses down and it says he is in my back yard or in the neighbors backyard in the opposite direction he is in. He really won’t wear the watch, he is 7 but not a stalky kid more average and it’s too bulky. Is there a softer casing for the watch available?

My child has had this watch for a few years and it seems to work well. He’s not a big texter, so he uses that feature very infrequently. He doesn’t use the music feature at all, and likewise, I never use the gps or remote answer features, so can’t speak to those. For us, the phone is just used for basic communication (occasional calls) which it has been sufficient for. A few cons:1. The watch is a little bulky for a child’s wrist.2. Once in a while I’ll get a call from the watch when my son hasn’t actually called me. The watch could benefit from a redesign to make it less easy for a child to inadvertently make an accidental call. 3. The watch sends a lot of notifications (updates, etc.) which can make the wearer think that they are getting incoming texts, which can be disruptive. The watch is water resistant and seems pretty rugged. The band has held up and not needed replacement. In general, we are pretty happy with it.

This watch accidentally makes calls all the time. Seems it is very easy to accidentally bump it and unknowingly have it make a call and then the person receiving the call doesn’t know what’s going on. Maybe my child is just extra clumsy but I feel like her coat sleeve sets it off often. Or maybe it’s just something glitchy with the watch’s system, like others have suggested. Not a big deal though once you realize that. Other than this issue, I think this is a great watch.

Review.Titre: Our son has thoroughly enjoyed his…
Review.Contenu: Our son has thoroughly enjoyed his watch over the past few months as well as us. It is a simple watch and the face has been fairly durable for a 10 year old boy. However, the band broke while he was jumping on the trampoline. We are currently working with customer service on getting this fixed.

The watch has all the basic functions that I was looking for, especially the dnd function is super useful, however we never managed to make the facetalk function work…  The big issue for us with this watch is the band, it was broken within 2 weeks of normal use.  The band is fixed to the body of the watch with no wiggle room, so be super careful with it.  The customer service is great, super responsive.

Review.Titre: I have these watches for my 2 sons and…
Review.Contenu: I have these watches for my 2 sons and my grandson I love that I can track them and call them while playing outside. I gave 3 stars because the watch band breaks easily and instead of being able to replace the band only you need to buy a whole new watch.

Was not easy to switch from the $20 per month subscription to the $10 per month subscription. I ended up waiting it out and resubscribing after it ran out. Also, when my daughter text me it does not always notify me from the app. Often my app will have me signed out and I have to sign back into it again. I wish there was a way to text back and forth regularly, without the use of the app. I understand it helps to monitor the texting. If she had the ability to text only her approved contacts, without having to use the app, that would be ideal.

Review.Titre: Looks like a great product with amazing…
Review.Contenu: Looks like a great product with amazing options. Unfortunately couldn't get it working. Emailed the tech support team (had to reach them on twitter to get a response) and I was told to try a different carrier. I live in Saudi Arabia and I'm using STC sim card. I tried another SIM but the issue still persist. Will try another one as recommended by the tech team (Zain). Hopefully it will work------Update: 26NOC2022Tech team has been incredibly supportive (Tiffiny) and the watch is working perfectly now with Zain. I hope soon it would work with STC (Saudi's & the region's biggest telecom company).I changed the rating from 1 to 3 star because of the battery life and the fact that the default music player doesn't work in Saudi Arabia and there's no alternative.  Apart from that, it's a great watch for kids. I'm likely to buy a new one for my daughter

The GPS always shows my kid is a 1-2 houses away. I wish my kid could free text rather than just voice text or choose pre-set texts. I wish it was not so big and bulky. I love that my kid can reach me when needed and vice versa. Set up was pretty straight forward. Battery life is good. You need wifi for video calling but if you purchase the monthly plan you don't need wifi for calling and texting.

Review.Titre: Loving the watch, though use caution around the band.
Review.Contenu: My son loves the watch. It has all the features we needed. Overall it’s built well, however the part of the band that is attached to the watch snapped after a couple of days. It’s not a part that should move around, like on most watches, so be careful of that! Everything else is sturdy. I’m working with customer service now about the broken part. They are responsive. I will update upon resolution of the problem.

Review.Titre: It's good when it works...until it dies
Review.Contenu: This is my third time buying a TickTalk watch.  The first was a TickTalk 3 for my older son.  The battery life of that model was terrible.  We then bought a TickTalk 4 for my younger son.  It worked pretty well, but sometimes it would stop working or charging, and after trouble shooting we got it to work again.  We uses it mostly for texting or calling to communicate with my son to pick up from school, and it served its purpose.  But after 1-1/2 years, the watch stopped charging for good.  My only option at that point was to mail it in at my cost to have the company test it, and if they could not revive it, then I could pay $100 to have it replaced.  A new one cost $150 with the Easter discount.  So I decided to buy a new one at that point, in order to have a working watch sooner, and with the cost to ship the old one back it would not have been far off from $150.  Honestly, I cannot wait until my younger son is old enough to have a phone.  At least then it would be more reliable and won't die so soon.

Review.Titre: The battery life is not what was…
Review.Contenu: The battery life is not what was expected.  The location data has improved since AT&T added a new tower in my town.

Review.Titre: I like that it's easy to use
Review.Contenu: I like that it's easy to use. Don't like that video calls don't work. Data fees are a bit expensive.

Review.Titre: Good watch,but lots of calls from…
Review.Contenu: Good watch,but lots of calls from unknown people. Number was most likely a recycled number resissued.
It does the job. How ever the GPS is not accurate as portrayed.  It's usually at least half a mile to a mile off.

Review.Titre: It got so hot the first day that it…
Review.Contenu: It got so hot the first day that it burned my daughter. I liked that the watch arrived quickly.

Review.Titre: I feel like it works sometimes
Review.Contenu: I feel like it works sometimes. Currently it is not working and I cannot figure out why. Location is iffy. Sometimes it is an expensive paperweight. Remote calling is the only reason I like it and I feel like maybe that available elsewhere so why so expensive if it’s so iffy? No customer service available, it’s a voicemail. Expensive China toy. I’m considering returning it.

Review.Titre: Love the watch, but not the software issues
Review.Contenu: Love the watch, but we have only had it for four days and it is now rebooting over and over and totally unusable. Called customer service who said it is a software issue and that I have to submit a form, wait for support to reply, then send in the watch and wait.

Review.Titre: The watch works great but I mis read…
Review.Contenu: The watch works great but I mis read about the features and most of them are limited to the brand of watch.  The watch can not text approved contacts unless they are with ticktalk so only the call feature works as the kids in the neighborhood have all different brands.   I also had a different impression of the warranty until I had to use it and realized it didn’t cover much.  Over all the watch is great and love the gps feature and listen in feature.  The gps does get wacky if it’s on wifi and shows he’s in a different state which kinda sucks.

Review.Titre: You Must Buy to your Kids
Review.Contenu: It is awesome and my kid loves it, easy to use track his location, communicate with him without getting mobile at end it’s mandatory to buy for your kids instead of mobile I do recommend to add below:1. can share my kid location or get direction to his location 2. add walkie talkie in the app and watch.3. greeting card should be more to covers more religions and cultures.

Great Device....but needs work. when compared to Watches from Tmobile and Verizon.  My Son loves the rugged design and the Camera.What needs work...-Video Call is limited to 3 minutes on Wife!?? Why? its using Battery power, its heating up ?? But you start another Video call right after?? super Annoying !!...Please increase to something reasonable.. 10min or calculate based on battery percentage. Cannot Text contacts outside of the app...Other Watches like TMobile...you can text to approved USERS...you dont need to install Ticktalk app for everyone. very Useful for emergencies. No Geo Fencing. Does not have GSM for more accurate location.

Locations tracker inaccurate！！ I have to return this product and pay for shipping cost by myself！I used my cell phone’s SIM card in  the watch, the SIM card in my phone works great, but in the watch… the location shows me in somewhere 30 miles away. And location keep changing from north to south. Useless

Bit of false advertising... NOT a GPS watch but uses same flawed cell tower technology as other cheaper watches.. GPS ONLY if all Cell towers down, and no public wifi.. Means your child can suddenly appear to be in china if wifi in area is still registered there!!!.. Son sits next to me and shows 5 miles away... If you need SAFE connectivity with child (blocks other sms/calls) then a great product... if you need GPS location... Think apple watch

Review.Titre: Good watch but Tracker not working
Review.Contenu: The call, video, text and music are awesome and for the most part easy to use but for some reason the tracker isn’t working it keeps saying my child is offline which I’m really bummed about

Just got this watch for my 11 year old for Christmas and I am already concerned by it's tight fit. In theory, it looks like it will work for our needs. He keeps losing his cellphone so I am hoping with this being attached to his body he will keep up with it. I love the easy setup, app, and watch features. Just worried that my son will outgrow the wristband fairly quickly. Will update later

This product is great when it comes to limiting who your child has contact with. Kind of confusing to set up if you are just a family member getting the app to contact the child. I live in a good service area but my child has a hard to sending voice to text messages. It fails almost every time. No issues with just voice texts. The battery life is less than desirable.it won’t last a day. Also, the gps is always off by at least a mile and a half. But, I’m glad my child can call friends and family when they need.

Review.Titre: I’ve been loving the Ticktalk with some…
Review.Contenu: I’ve been loving the Ticktalk with some reservations until today, when I went to check my sons location and it told me he was in Detroit (I am in Minneapolis, as was he.) Setting it up is somewhat complicated, and the phone service they recommend starting with attempts to send him Messages upselling data and minutes. On the plus side it’s been incredibly convenient to be able to get ahold of him, but I no longer trust the location service.

Review.Titre: The watch is huge- way too big for my…
Review.Contenu: The watch is huge- way too big for my daughter to wear comfortably. (She just carries it in her backpack).  I bought it to take to school and be able to monitor her as she gets off the bus and walks home. GPS service is very inconsistent. They blamed it on AT&T but I have the same carrier for my phone and don’t have the problems this watch has. She’s able to text/call without problems as long as she’s connected to WiFi.

Review.Titre: I love almost everything about the…
Review.Contenu: I love almost everything about the phone. My boys can call me, they can listen to music, they can take pictures, I can block features I don't want them to have, etc. However, with the T-Mobile version, I can't get many bars of service despite living in the city, and therefore the GPS is off by about 1/2 mile most of the time - GPS was my primary reason for getting the watch.

Review.Titre: We upgraded our TickTalk 3 to Ticktalk4…
Review.Contenu: We upgraded our TickTalk 3 to Ticktalk4 and the battery lasts a lot longer. The product itself is good. But the Customer service definitely has room to improve. Maybe because we're international order, we don't get the same support as local orders. We don't get things sent as replacement just because we're not in the States. With our TickTalk 3, we had problem with the charging cable and customer service agree to send us a new cable. But at the end, it never got sent after waiting for a few months. Then they said I need to send the whole watch back. We got a replacement watch but the monitor didn't work after a few months. And since it's out of warranty, there's nothing they could do. We just felt like things would've been different if they'd just send us a new cable. The replacement watch lasted only a few months.

Very disappointed in service.  70% of the time it says she's in Florida when she's really in Georgia. The main reason for buying this watch was for tracking and I don't trust it all all now.  Getting other people connected with her though the app was too difficult and there were days when it wouldn't even let me the MAIN ADMINISTRATOR call her

Review.Titre: Love the watch but not customer support!
Review.Contenu: I love the product and my child loves it but wish that customer support was a little better. I purchased the new TickTalk 4 from Kickstarter but did not receive any site points on myticktalk.com even though they pushed really hard for watches and accessories to be purchased from there. I have an account on myticktalk.com and can't attach my order to it.

Review.Titre: Android 12 not supported location tracking is so so
Review.Contenu: Android 12 is still not supported by the app. I am unable to make video calls from or to the device. Additionally, device lacks robust location tracking features. No way to setup geo fencing to notify that the watch is out of a certain area or when the device enters a specific area.

The watch is great. If I have to rate the watch I’ll give it 5 stars but if I have to rate TickTalk.com I can’t give it 5 or 4. The auto we service is a truly important part of a company... try to call or chat for information. The lady that answer is the same in both! She is not helpful or nice! They have bad customer service.

I love the concept but texts are a challenge as the voice to text is not accurate and we have yet to figure out how to type text. I’d have liked an owner’s manual to be included. I am a kinesthetic learner and that would make it easier for me to learn how to use this. Lastly, customer service is a challenge. My purchase was listed as shipped on a Friday. I paid an  exorbitant  amount of money for overnight shipping and it did not arrive until Monday.  Customer service does not understand my concern that no where in the policy does it say over night shipping on Friday is actually next business day. I wouldn’t have selected that option had I known.

Love love love the functions of the watch I bought for my grandson! My only complaint is the band. My grandson complains that it’s hot &  “itchy”, & it’s too big. Therefore, he takes it off, & that’s not a good thing. Kinda defeats the purpose. I’d like to see a smaller (shorter) band made for smaller children, like a 4 yr old, & a different material that isn’t so hot & itchy for a little one. Thanks!

Review.Titre: I was unaware that a video call could…
Review.Contenu: I was unaware that a video call could not go over 3 minutes. I thought this would be a good way for my daughter to keep in touch with her grandparents, and 3 minutes is just not enough time. Otherwise the product does work well. My daughter dislikes that the watch does not have games, but that was a plus for me.

I would prefer if authorized contacts could text outside the app using a regular phone. The location is sometimes very inaccurate, sometimes by more than a mile.He sometimes has a hard time hearing callers on the watch. Other than that, so far so good.

My daughter has a Tick Talk 3 and it gives an almost exact location of the watch. However, we bought a Tick Talk 4 which gives a location that can be up to 2 miles away from the actual watch. This defeats the purpose of tracking location.The Tick Talk 4 is a bit clunky and seems to keep rotating around the wrist.The Tick Talk 3 velcro straps seem to loosen over time as well.  I wish the Mom and Dad icons would allow an actual picture to show. It doesn't make sense to have a picture uploaded and then it does not display when selecting a contact.

Review.Titre: The watch is great but the themes are…
Review.Contenu: The watch is great but the themes are not child friendly- I have 3 girls who don’t have much of options for themes on the watch-  and not very impressed with the clock face option- for how much the watch is not impressed. But the watch works great with the calling option.

Review.Titre: I bought two tick-tock watches and…
Review.Contenu: I bought two tick-tock watches and there was an add that said Black Friday $40 off. It was not honored which was very disappointing since I had a screenshot of the discount. Other than that, my experience was fine. We haven’t used the watches yet since they are Christmas gifts.

Review.Titre: Exactly what I was looking for…with one huge issue
Review.Contenu: This was exactly what I was looking for my 8 year old daughter.  I don't want her glued to a smart phone, but wanted to know where she is in the neighborhood at any time, can text or phone me and not have a huge monthly bill.  Though it works with T-Mobile which is a nice option.  Unfortunately this smartwatch ultimately was disappointing as it uses a low end battery.  Even on standby it won't last a day...my daughter uses it a few times and the battery is dead in 4 hours or less.  Can't give it more than 3 stars...close to greatness but falls short.

I received the watch very quickly. My daughter was thrilled and immediately put it on to go show her friends. She wore it for 2 hours and I noticed the screen looked like it was going out.  I put it on charge then the next morning the screen would not come on at all. I believe it was a random defect because I have heard nothing but good things about this watch. I applaud their customer service department for a prompt response to my email. They sent me a return label and offered a free chum for the Inconvenience. Of course my daughter was devastated to have to send it back but hopefully we will not have this problem again. I’m still awaiting the replacement watch.

Review.Titre: Great watch- location function needs improvement
Review.Contenu: We have two TickTalk 4 watches for my 8 year old twins. There is much to like about these & overall we are happy with them the main disappointment is the location feature. Recent within the same hour while we were on the coast of Washington state my daughter was shown as being  in the ocean in town,  and most surprisingly in Los Angeles. Typically their location is off by several blocks in Seattle.  One of the reasons we got the watch is because they will be going on a road trip with their grandparents this summer and based on what we’ve seen I don’t think the location feature is going to be very insightful.Wish the location function was better.
After a little less than 1 year the band fractured at the connection to the camera.The limited warranty specifically excludes this as though it is a known issue.

Review.Titre: Customer service never got back to me…
Review.Contenu: Customer service never got back to me on how to update new ticktalk 4. I called several times and was told someone would call me back and nothing. Other than that the product got to me quick and my daughter loves it!!!

Review.Titre: Video quality is bad enough that it…
Review.Contenu: Video quality is bad enough that it probably shouldn’t be a feature. Pretty cool device with great gps tracking. Probably could cut out some unnecessary features and make it cheaper or produce a “basic” line.

Review.Titre: We ordered our daughter a watch for…
Review.Contenu: We ordered our daughter a watch for Christmas. Design, colors, and apps are great!! The only issue I have found is that the battery runs down very quickly. Is this were to be fixed, I’d give the watch 5 stars.

Review.Titre: I would have given 5 stars if the power…
Review.Contenu: I would have given 5 stars if the power base I also baught had arrived with the watch. The Talk 4 is a very good watch for kids and works much better than the T-Mobile timex kids watch.  The customer service via email was alright but do not like having an email sent implying I did something wrong. I also have not heard back from them for almost 1.5 wks after I sent pics of the watch box and the shipping box to them. Reason again for 3 stars is I absolutely hate to pay for something and not receive it.  To me this is fraud.If I hear back and have the power base sent I will consider reevaluating to a 5 star rating.  As I said the watch itself is awesome for my 8 yr old. No need for a phone he may loss or drop and break and the tracking is pretty accurate.  Works very well with T-Mobile.

Review.Titre: This watch is great for my son, but broke quickly
Review.Contenu: This watch is great for my son. He can keep track of time and we can get a hold off him. Unfortunately the side where the band goes through broke, so he was unable to wear it.
It works well enough. However, my kid took a shower with it on and it isn’t working now. I thought it would be more waterproof. Very expensive to try to replace. Sigh

Review.Titre: 1) The clarity between the service of…
Review.Contenu: 1) The clarity between the service of Red Pocket being "Supported with T-Mobile and AT&T" or just solely using T-Mobile (In my case) is not clearly explained. There is extreme confusion that even your tech support could not explain correctly. 2) The typing keypad does not work well and many icons do not register a touch.3) There is no ability to turn off the Step-Counter.4) The watch does not always send a notification of a text message. This is extremely important!5) The WiFi connection does not appear to work when wanting to play music. This is false advertisement and just plainly a lie if we can't get it to work.Update 6 Apr, 2022...6) My son just received a call from a stranger who said she was returning a call from this number. As I questioned her she stated the call came to her as "No caller ID" yet, she called the number. This indicates she was lying and was working a scam. This is alarming!
Overall .. performs as described..Occasionally the watch will go "offline" at random times and duration.. and I am unable to communicate with my child ..

Review.Titre: I bought the watch for my Grandson
Review.Contenu: I bought the watch for my Grandson, he is up and running; I have not connected yet.  It is a process to set up the app.

Review.Titre: Screen great; connection not the best
Review.Contenu: Love the size of screen.  Not crazy about band on TickTalk 4.  Also have trouble with keeping watch connected to app.  Disconnects frequently.

Review.Titre: We love our TickTalk 4 with one major…
Review.Contenu: We love our TickTalk 4 with one major problem. The band isn’t comfortable and doesn’t seem to have a way to change it. Neither of my kids can put it on easily or take it off easily which defeats the independence I was hoping to promote. If I could figure out how to get a Velcro style band on there they would wear it every day. Features are great. I considered TickTalk 3 to fix the band situation but I haven’t heard great things in the screen sensitivity. Plus, I already paid for these.  It’s a bummer bc I really want to love them. If anyone finds a band solution, please let me know. I’d be happy to shell out another $25 to make them more comfortable and on/off friendly. I’m considering creating some type of band cover that Velcros but I don’t know if it would be worth it. I’ve told them that I’m going to cancel red pocket if they don’t start wearing them more… giving it another month. How is this great tech worth it if it’s so uncomfortable? Both my kids are on the smaller end but they got home from school and immediately wanted it off.
The delivery is fast But why did the driver ask for 57 SAR??NEXT TIME WRITE THE TOTAL PRICE

Review.Titre: Mostly satisfied update are done quick…
Review.Contenu: Mostly satisfied update are done quick but the usability of the watch when not with a carrier is not what I would like
There were no paper instructions, I relied on YouTube. For almost $200 per watch it should include a charger base.

The speakerphone function does not let me hear my child's voice when his arm is hanging down to his side. The speakerphone seems to be inferior to that of the TickTalk 3.  He has to hold the watch phone right next to his mouth in order to be heard and that was not the case with the 3.  Also even though the phone is on silent, a beep is still made when a call is hung up. That is NOT silent mode. Please fix that.  I'm much prefer the external watch design of The ticktalk three because the tick tock four has so many little nooks and crannies that collect with dirt. The speaker on the floor is also wide open to collecting dirt.  I miss the Velcro band.Overall the telephone reception of the watch from a signal perspective, and from a programming perspective, seems to be superior.I don't like not being able to select what stations my son can listen to on iheartradio. Even the family app includes negative cultural references that I don't appreciate. There needs to be a selection of a Christian channel.  Many Christian families use this watch to safeguard their children from negative side effects of other phones.  Offer a Christian music station please. Thanks

Update: I had finally received my sons replacement, even though it took awhile to get and 2 replacement later. He finally is able to wear it and I’m finally able to get peace knowing I can locate and talk to my son. The only thing I would say is I wish there was something to cover where the charger port is. I cover my sons with a small band aid. I live in AZ and it’s hot and it’s natural to sweat. Plus the band is made of silicone so It’s bound to happen.When I first received my sons watch it was working fine for about a month before it stopped charging. I purchased the 2 year extended warranty and made a claim. I sent my watch with the charger that it came with. When I received an email stating my watch was delivered. I checked my mail and received an envelope which was weird because I thought it would be in a box. But the envelope only had just the charger port. Not the wire or watch itself. It’s going on 3 weeks and still have not received my wire or watch. I’m so upset because I cannot get a hold of anybody on the phone and I keep getting an email saying it was delivered. I emailed them back with a picture of my mail. Im so upset because This whole warranty has been a nightmare and feels like I wasted money.

My son tried a few different watches before using TickTalk for almost a year. The TickTalk watch had a good platform and was easy to use. I like that I can reject all incoming calls, except for certain numbers. What really sold us was the band. Which unfortunately they got rid of on the TickTalk 4. This was a big problem with other watches always sliding around. He could have it for his exact size wrist. The battery life was VERY short. He needed to plug it in EVERY day or it would die. The charging port is awful. If it's not in the absolute perfect position it doesn't charge. After 10 months the watch stopped charging after installing a new update. Customer service was awful. Took days to get back to me. Promised 2-3 day turn around time and still nothing almost 2 weeks later. We liked the watch but was really frustrated with customer service saying the watch had water damage when the watch continued to work just fine, it just wouldn't charge after the update. After reading other reviews I realized the batteries all had problems and there were a lot of complaints. Clearly there's an issue with them that needs to be addressed. Sounds like the warranty is utter crap too. How frustrating.

Review.Titre: Updated review by a real person!! Swing and a miss
Review.Contenu: Updated Review: I have been using this watch for the last few weeks and after the update, I would like to change my review. Even though, what I said is still true, the watch has performed well thus far. There is still no better option out there. As far as kids watches go, there can be easy improvements, but it's still head above shoulders better than anything out there. And when you call them, they ANSWER!!!! I recommend this watchThe phone is huge, the music app never works, when you go to send a message the contacts do not autopopulate, only 1 person. The call reception is worse than the previous generation and that's its main function. PLUS!!!! you only have a few interactions with the staff to get help. I think they're done dealing with me so I'm left with this POS!!! could've done great, the concept is fabulous, no games. Theres too many yes people in that office who aren't giving you guys good advice moving forward, but whatever. I'm sure everyone wants to be surrounded by people who think their ideas are great, while destroying the product. In an effort to keep your job. problem is, is that's its still probably the best in class in that cztagory, feels like accepting subpar or wishing I can buy a previous generation

Edited to add: there is a “me” icon on the map, but no directions to my child. I would need to leave the app and type in a hopefully accurate address. What I wish it had:1) In-app GPS directions from me to my child 2) Louder phone call volume. Child must have quiet surroundings in order to hear me at all3) Geofencing (like Gizmo has) so I can be alerted when my child goes beyond set boundaries 4) Auto answer (like Gizmo has) so I can speak to child instantly Please add these features to updates on TickTalk4!What I love:1) Super hearing feature! Gizmo doesn’t have this, although their auto answer feature might accomplish something similar. 2) GPS tracker (though address shown when he’s home is always next door 😬, so accuracy could be an issue in an emergency). All watches may struggle with total accuracy. 3) My kid loves the 2-sided camera, allowing for fun picture taking and video calls. This sets it apart from Gizmo and other watches!4) Comes in black instead of ONLY retina-burning blue and pink like Gizmo offer. Note: cheapest phone plan available is $10/mo, so when considering the expense, you will not only be paying for the watch, but also an annual fee of at least $120...which is certainly worth lowering the risk of my child going missing, but still something to keep in mind.

Review.Titre: The TickTalk watch is pretty good
Review.Contenu: The TickTalk watch is pretty good. It has some features that are important, like gps tracking, and blocking unknown callers. However, there are some features I wish it had and some I wish it didn’t have. It would be better if the contacts we approved to contact the watch did not have to download the app and create an account just to text and FaceTime. I understand the level of security but when you have over 20 contacts for your child, it gets tiring when everyone has to make an account and pair their phones to the watch. It’s just too many steps. It would be better if they could just contact the watch without having to do the whole set up. I also don’t like that we can’t see and review the messages between the other contacts. Since everyone has their own login, me as the admin, is unable to see what and who my child is texting. That’s a level of security that I think is very important. How are we supposed to monitor what is going on if we can’t review and see what is being said. Also, the in call volume on the watch is too low. There is no way to turn it up higher once it reached max level in a call and myself and children can’t hear the other person on the phone. Lastly, the contacts on the watch. If my child is scrolling to find someone specific to call and accidentally touches another name, it calls that person automatically. There should be a confirmation asking if they want to call that contact so it gives them the option to back out and keep scrolling. Overall, the watch is okay, if the features I mentioned isn’t important to a potential customer then I would recommend it.

Review.Titre: Bought 2 TT3s, one worked great, the other not so much
Review.Contenu: We've been looking for two SIM watches for about a year.  We were convinced the TT3 would be better for us than the Gizmo (Verizon).  The website was helpful, and Red Pocket seemed like a good choice for us (also a good website).  We received the watches a few days before Christmas and set them up (not the easiest process, but the videos on the TT website were clear and helpful.   Where we ran into trouble was 1) One of the two TT3s we bought worked great, basically just as advertised.  The other, however, had a microphone issue -- my youngest could hear me, but I couldn't hear her.  2) There was no live tech support from Xmas day until the following Monday!!!  That was a total shock.  If I'm releasing a new version of my tech device, I can't imagine not having live tech support for 4 days after 1000s of these watches are opened by eager children on Christmas.  We then dialed in Monday and the chat-support has seemed to be pretty clearly totally overwhelmed.  They're supplying us with a return label and are offering to replace her band with a color she's more excited about, so that's great.  We'll just see if the return goes smoothly (crossed fingers).  If so, and the new watch is delivered as promised and works like my other daughter's, then this review would go up to 4 stars -- when working, the watches seem really good.

First, I want to start out saying, we love TickTalk. We have 3. Two TickTalk 3s and now a 4. We’re customers for the long haul! The Kickstarter campaign and communication about the product were tremendous! Shipping was great. We love the easy setup and the app is GREAT!I do have some feedback about the 4 and things were noticing.1. When my son makes a call or receives a call, the screen then dims and he’s never able to hit the “end” button. Even if he presses the wake button, it doesn’t take him to the call screen. It just takes him to all of his other options, so the call just keeps going in the background. Also when he’s on a screen, there isn’t a back button or anything to get out of the screen he’s in. Maybe we’re missing something.2. Our pictures do not appear on his screen when we call him or he calls us. It just says our names even though we’re added as contacts with pictures (like I said, we have the 3s and it works on those. The 4 is set up the same way with our pictures). I called when we first got it, and they said this is a glitch and an update would be released within the week to fix it but it’s still happening.3. While I love the improvement and higher quality of the watch and screen (MUCH easier to press options ☺️), are there talks of a screen protector? Within a day of my son wearing it, there were significant scratches. Since, we’ve put liquid glass on it but I’m not sure how well that’ll do.Just some questions. No concerns ☺️ Thank you for your amazing product!
Phone works well. App is giving some problems to set up

Review.Titre: A rough user experience but with a decent device (TickTalk 4)
Review.Contenu: The version that ended up ordered was on the AT&T network instead of T-Mobile. The interface and cart details could be improved to avoid this. Then I got a T-Mobile SIM but couldn't activate it on the TickTalk Wireless site. Turns out that although the SIM was white-colored and the QR code sticker took me to the TickTalk Wireless site, it was a Red Pocket SIM. There was no visual or evident indication of the Red Pocket network. How would a customer know this? After waiting the whole weekend to talk to support on Monday, I was then thrown at the Red Pocket site and basically told to "figure it out... you have to call Red Pocket if you encounter any problems". Not a great customer experience. I was then able to create an account and figure things out on my own. Red Pocket's interface is bad. The overall activation experience is cumbersome and not user friendly. It would be nice if customers could have the ability to choose the wireless network provider when making their purchase or if TickTalk could properly identify the SIM card or provide instructions to identify it.The overall apps/sites experience is also not great. You have 3 different usernames/passwords: one for the TickTalk site (orders), another for TickTalk Wireless, and then another one for the mobile app. The whole thing is complicated if you are not tech savvy. Also, the login screen in the mobile app is not password manager friendly.That said, there are not many comparable smartwatches out there, so customers (like me) do their best to navigate these user experience issues. Once you configure everything, I can't deny that the smartwatch has been pretty reliable. Parental controls are a little tricky to understand at first, but they have some very good options. It's only a week of use, but the device has already been a game changer in terms of communicating and knowing where our kid is. The group chat feature has been the best way to simplify communications between our kid and both of us parents. The charger is just a USB A cable with a special terminal connector that plugs in the back of the watch. It would be nice if the USB wall charger was provided with the device. After reading so many reviews and looking at all options available (in 2022), my experience is that the TickTalk 4 seems the best option to give our kid a phone-like device with parental controls without actually handing them a phone.

Review.Titre: Like is so far only thing I don’t like…
