Review.Contenu: Like is so far only thing I don’t like is that it gets hot

Review.Titre: Hanging in there as we wait....
Review.Contenu: I contacted technical support through email when one of our Tick Talk 4 watches kept disconnecting from the network while he was at school.  This made it unable to track him and caused the watch to stay in do not disturb mode (DND) until we restarted it.  We have a second Tick Talk 4 for our other child that works without issue while he is at the same school.The response from technical support was that I should reset the watch and start from scratch.  I was not pleased with this answer as it didn't make sense as the watch worked perfectly when it was not in DND mode.  I then asked if I could restore my son's data from the T-Cloud when I reset it, but I was told that I couldn't and my son would lose all of his settings and photos.The next thing that happened was the watch just shut off and wouldn't turn back on.  When I contacted technical support again, I was told that it may be because his watch was out of data.  As you can understand, this was a frustrating suggestion and I responded to let them know that.I was then told that I could send the watch in for inspection, but that if the watch has any water damage, then we have to pay $100.  This seems like a setup since the watch never worked right from the first day we received it, yet this allows the customer service department to declare it is our fault without proof.  The other issue we now have is that we are without a watch for our son during the Summer.  I use this to allow him to go to the park and visit friends so I may keep an eye on him while I work from home.  It may be several weeks (they use USPS for mailing) for the broken watch to be received and the new watch to arrive at our house.  I would make the following recommendations to Tick Talk 4 due to my situation:1.  When a watch doesn't work right from the beginning, please do not threaten a $100 fine for water damage.  2. Send a replacement watch while the damaged watch is being sent back.  You could always put a $100 hold on the customer's card while you inspect it.  This allows the customer to use the product while they wait for the damaged watch to be inspected.
Brazilian phone numbers does not seems to be configured well. Internet functions work well
Customer service is solid, and the watch is great for a young teen/tween.  The app is a bit buggy at times.

We chose the TickTalk watch so my 9 year old could send actual text messages.  It is wonderful when it is working and she will check in frequently!  The GPS is typically very accurate for us.  The watch itself is a bit bulky compared to others but it doesn't seem to bother her.  We have had to send the watch in a twice as it stopped working.  Both times, the customer service has been excellent.  They pick up the phone immediately, work hard to trouble shoot, and respond near immediately when the watch is received for repair.  Tiffany especially went above and beyond to help with the most recent repair.

Have the watch for a little over a year for my 9-year old boy. Having him wearing the watch when he's out playing with neighbors is a nice peace-of-mind. Kids are not very careful with wearable devices, and I need to have the watch replaced twice now with screen issues, but TickTalk's customer service is excellent, and I can always reach a real person to help when needed - this unfortunately is not a standard expectation nowadays, so I really appreciate the personal touch.

Review.Titre: The watch has honestly surprised me on…
Review.Contenu: The watch has honestly surprised me on how advanced it works and how much you can control in the app and how clear the images are. All in all has been great for my first time purchasing a watch for my daughter and it gives me a sense of comfort. My only drawback was the GPS using hotspot and approximate location rather than exact location but maybe im missing something. Would definately reccomend

We had recently moved to a new state and wanted to sign our 6 yr old up for summer camp in our new area. We felt like he was too young for a phone but really wanted a way to communicate with him and to be able to keep tabs on his location. After doing a little research for the options that are currently available, we decided on the Tick Talk watch. It has definitely met and exceeded expectations for both of us parents, and our 6 yr old loves all of the features as well.We did have an issue with the band snapping off about 2 months after purchasing (daily use), but the company was quick to respond, and getting it replaced was quite easy.

Review.Titre: Intuitive watch to stay connected with…
Review.Contenu: Intuitive watch to stay connected with your child in a safe way! This watch is much bulkier than others I’ve tried, but I love all the parental settings and video calling option that many others don’t have! I bought this for my 6 yr old to stay connected with both parents (divorced) while with the other. Would recommend!

watch is working as it should. Had it for almost a year now. It would be better if the GPS location is accurate, it show my daughter in a different state sometimes. Pros:Remote listeningparental controlDo not disturb mode (best part of the watch, no accidental dial)Cons:GPS can be betterwatch is bulkyshould come with free screen protector (kids are not careful)

Review.Titre: Very good overall, but a few accidental calls
Review.Contenu: The Tick Talk 4 has been very good overall in the 6 months our daughter has used it but there have been a few times that the watch has called out on its own.  I’m not sure if the shortcut key is a bit sticky or if she accidentally hits the button but sometimes I’ll get a call that wasn’t intended.

Review.Titre: 8 year old loves it, mom does too
Review.Contenu: This smart watch was very easy to set up and my 8 year loves exploring it. As a parent, I love the safety measures that he can't access the internet or make outgoing calls or texts to any phone number I don't pre-program. That said, as a heads up, he can receive incoming calls from anyone initially (but you can block unknown calls, thank goodness)! My kiddo absolutely loves the texting feature and that there is a kid-friendly spooky podcast through the I-heart-radio built-in app. The only downside so far (aside from battery life) is that it's a little too easy for him to accidentally call me, and on the first day, it happened at least 10-15 times. Overall though, this is an excellent product, and my kiddo is thrilled.

This is our second Tick Talk purchase because our son forgot he was wearing it and jumped in the lake.  We like the watch enough that we purchased another one, but certainly wish we would have purchased the insurance the first time. :)

Review.Titre: Getting Tick Talk 4 for my son provides independence
Review.Contenu: Getting Tick Talk 4 for my son has been a great decision. He has the ability to feel independent, while I know that he’s safe. He enjoys the long battery life, dual cameras, being able to stream music and just having his ‘phone’ on his wrist. Customer service has also been amazing as they are direct and respond quickly.

My kid loves the watch and wears it all the time. The screen is bright and the functionality is honestly hard to beat after searching high and low at all the options out there. It was easy to set up and I love the fact that parents can control everything through the app. The app was a pleasant surprise being very responsive and easy to use. The only thing I would call out is the calling feature. It definitely works but the calls can drop sometimes but the texting feature seems solid. Overall great watch that kids will enjoy.

Bought their TickTalk 4 watch. Overall this is a good watch for small kids. They can call you quite easily. You can listen in to make sure they're OK. The battery life is good unless the reception is poor. Then it can drain quickly searching for a signal. A flaw in the watches design is how it charges. Bare connection on the underside are susceptible to sweat and water (like when a small child washes their hands). Another issue is the GPS positioning. Sometimes it's spot on, others it's a 1/2 mile off. But like I said, overall it's a good watch for keeping an eye on your child. Their support / customer service is pretty responsive and helpful.

Review.Titre: Watch is cool and good, so far, but...
Review.Contenu: Watch is cool and good, so far, but Customer Service has been a little difficult getting full and complete answers out of, which is the reason why I only gave 4/5 stars. When signing up for the plan, there aren't any details on overages, fees, additional charges, etc., and when I reached out to TickTalk to find out more, they never really answered my questions fully and it took a few back-and-forth attempts for them to even respond to my queries. The nice thing is, they were prompt in their replies and the watch is working great, so far!

Ordered a TickTalk4 from the company directly for Black Friday. Plugged in my data only SIM card and most functions work flawlessly. Of course you can't dial out but that was expected with a data only SIM card. What I would improve - (1) Allow parents to change icon order in the watch UI, (2) Allow facetalk/facetime to work on cellular connections not just WiFi. Overall good experience.

We’ve ordered 2 TickTalk 4 watches for our sons (8 and 6), and they’ve been pretty easy for them to use to message or call us if needed and have been a mostly good purchase. The only real issue we’ve run into is with one of the watches the hinge where the band attaches to the case, it has broken twice, this last time after only 5 months. The watches are not generally worn unless we’re out of the house and not used during play. The original watch has several years of use without issue. What’s offset the issue with the second watch is the great customer support we’ve experienced, most recently with Tiffiny Adams who quickly responded to our message with the offer to replace the watch. Great customer service is definitely keeping us with the company.

purchased ticktalk4 for our 10 yr old...we didn't want to get him a device which can access an internet browser or social media. This turned out to be a great purchase...he loved the watch.Pros: Good build quality, clear and responsive touch screen, has gps tracking, works w/ Mint mobile, can limit usage and set times when watch can't be used for activities other than tracking and clock. Battery can be good for a little over a day when you set the location tracking to on demand and do not disturb modes are set up.Cons: Battery life might be a problem if you leave tracking on often, the watch is big for smaller kids, on screen keyboard typing (when setting up wifi, etc.) is painful to use, direct messaging only within the ticktalk app if your firewall is enabled, ticktalk app does take a little time to set up fully and there is a small learning curve for the parents.Overall: good features, quality build, and just what we needed for our kid.

Review.Titre: Got it for our son for his 7th bday
Review.Contenu: Got it for our son for his 7th bday, Okay watch, lacks some configuration options I’d like to see to add some additional limitations to what my son can do. Also it’s impossible or I’m doing it wrong adding a dnd schedule during evening until next morning to prevent him being able to mess with it when he’s supposed to sleep. Simply doesn’t allow schedule to be from one day into another…other than that, call quality is good let’s hope the watch lasts some years.

My son loves his watch! The tracking isn’t as reliable as I had hoped (it showed him states away today when he was on the school bus headed home), but I love the ability to reach him immediately when necessary! I don’t care for some of the settings, as I thought he’d be able to FaceTime his friends that also have the watch (he can’t FaceTime or text them). There is a learning curve that I’m still working on, but overall the service has been good and the ability to reach my child has been wonderful. The watch seems durable-although bulky, but does seem like it will withstand a child for a while.

Overall the TickTalk4 watch is a big improvement over the previous model and is well worth the invetstment. My child really likes the music app addition. One area that needs improvement is the SIM cover on the back. It is extremely difficult to remove even with the removal tool and did hit me in the face

Review.Titre: A Great Way to communicate and keep up with your kid's whereabouts
Review.Contenu: Overall, pretty pleased with the product. Can locate my child and communicate if need be. My only real gripe thus far is that there seems to be no way to monitor minutes used on the app or the watch. Perhaps, an intentional decision. Other than that, the product works as intended. Pleased customer.

Review.Titre: Quick setup, works well, a few quirks, kids love it
Review.Contenu: I bought one for each of my sons. They are pretty easy to set up but there are a few things that could be improved. It would be nice to manage contacts for both devices in one place instead of having to do that for each one from the app. It would also be nice if you could send texts directly to the phone instead of having to use the app for messages. It would be nice if you could toggle calls and/or texts messaging for contacts so you didn’t have to set up the app for each person that wanted to message the device. Also, my sons can’t message each other’s TickTalk4 except through a group message. Please make texting the device possible instead of requiring the app for messages.

Ticktalk has been a great way to connect with my ten year old when she's out of the house, without getting her a phone. I also like the tracking feature so I can see when the school bus is on its way. I wish the GPS was a little more accurate and refreshed more often, but overall I am happy with function. The band randomly broke though after just a couple months of use. Customer service has always been very helpful and responsive.

We’ve had the watch for about a week now, and it works better than another watch we tried. Had some issues at first getting the calls to work. Once we turned off face call using wi fi only, we had much better luck getting it to work. Love the features, especially the music. School mode blocks everything, which wasn’t an option on the other watch brand. Also, really love the option to give limited access to family and friends, instead of everyone having full permission to use it. The plan cost $10 a month, and gives plenty of minutes and texts. So far so good, but we’ll see how it holds up after a while.

Gave our 8 year old grandson who lives in a different town a Tick Talk 4. We love being able to talk and text with him! The battery life isn’t great and the gps isn’t perfect. Usually shows he’s a couple of houses away from his home. But our main purpose was to be able to chat with him at our convenience and not have to wait until his parents phones were free Also love the safety of him not being able to use it unless we approve the contact. Overall very happy with purchase!

Customer service is great.  Watch is generally very good, but my son is starting to complain that it is very bulky.  And sometimes the location function is not accurate.But 5 stars for customer service, which has been very responsive every time I've had a question regarding the watch.

We received the watch quickly and very easy set up. However quality through shipping made this review 4 star because the band broke and the watch needed to be returned. Solid 4 star because customer service was great and resolved the issue quickly in order to do a replacement.

This watch is great - my son loves it and it's easy to keep in touch with him while he's out in the neighborhood. We've had a few warranty issues but Tiffiny and the customer service team always respond very quickly to solve any issues.

I have purchased two pcs. of TickTalk 4 watches for my 6 and 8-year-old boys. It quickly became their number one toy.But as a parent, I have a few concerns: because we live in Romania, Europe, we are unable to use the music application, which is promoted on the website and is not explicitly mentioned to be available only in the US. The second aspect is GPS tracking, which is inaccurate both outdoors and indoors where the phone is connected to the family's Wi-Fi network.In the dedicated application, after each action I perform, the message "operation successful" appears and remains on the screen until I dismiss it. I would prefer it to automatically disappear after 1-2 seconds.I don't know how other models behave, that's why I'm only talking about my experience with these watches. I offer this feedback for the improvement of the services provided and not as a complaint.

This is the 1st phone/watch for my 9yo. We were looking for a child-safe watch that would have specific features like GPS, messaging AND picture/video capabilities. So, we saw the TickTalk4 had all of those and purchased it. PROS: Overall, it's great. High quality. Got to us fast. Got an answer back quickly I had asked. Fair price. Easy setup. CONS: Things that I hope will be improved with the next edition: sound quality, added/approved people able to send regular text messages, different monthly data plan options, and we are having issues with the wi-fi connection to allow the watch to do wi-fi calls and video chat. Thank you for giving us a good, safe and reliable option for our family.

Review.Titre: Great and safe watch for kids
Review.Contenu: My son had his Ticktalk4 for almost a year and he really enjoys it. He loves the design of it and doesn't think that it is too big. he enjoys being able to customize a few things and what we like the most is to stay connected via text or calls.We did not give 5 stars because the GPS connection is sometimes off (like placing my son in chicago whereas we are in Cleveland) and because the brand broke after 9 months. But the customer service was very responsive to help us deal with the issue.The app is easy to use.Overall i recommend it.

Haven't used it much yet, just setting it up for Xmas. I don't like how you can't use the watch while it's charging, and I expected for it to be able to video call at any time, not just when it's connected to wifi, but other than that it seems fine.
Love the watch however his location is not 100% accurate, it is off half a mile which is verry important when he is at a friends house but it shows he is in the neighbourhood pk.

Likes:  Good call and video quality; remote check in feature,  decent battery life,  feels sturdy,  helpful customer serviceWhat could be better:  A video remote check in feature would be nice; need ability to rearrange watch icons, would be nice to be able to input contacts one time and apply it to multiple watches,  weekend customer service needed

Review.Titre: I contacted your support desk VA email…
Review.Contenu: I contacted your support desk via email twice this week to let the support desk know that we did not get our package and we're trying to figure out why we did not get our package. No one from support desk responded. I needed to know where FedEx or which door they drop it at so that I can go to that neighbor and ask them for the package. I sent that email to the support email about 2 hours after FedEx claim to have dropped the package. I haven't heard from anyone.Update: Called their customer service spoke to Tiffany they apologized immediately and reached out to the delivery agency. The product was in the mailbox. When you received it Thank you Tiffany from customer service. My only advice is to make clear in bold capitalized letters where the product is placed to minimize confusion. That would have allowed me to give a five-star.

Review.Titre: We gave this watch to my daughter for…
Review.Contenu: We gave this watch to my daughter for her birthday. She loves it and it has a bunch of cool features. Unfortunately the watch band broke off of the watch within 2 weeks. Customer service has been good so far about replacing the defective product.

Review.Titre: Loved This Watch - Literally a Life Saver
Review.Contenu: We bought this watch for our 9 year old for a gift and it was one of the best decisions we made - it literally saved a life! Out child was walking with his grandparent with they tripped and fell and were unconsious. Our child was able to call for emergency help as well as contact us using the watch to let us know what happened. Using the app we were able to locate their whereabouts and get to them quickly. Sadly the watch strap recently broke and the watch stopped charging. I was able to easily contact customer service and they walked me through the replacement steps. We eagerly await the new watch!

Review.Titre: We had an issue with the on/off button…
Review.Contenu: We had an issue with the on/off button approx 3 months after our purchase. We returned the defective watch and we were given a new replacement watch with no charge in a timely manner :)!

So far the TickTalk watch has been very reliable for my child and I. It’s a great way for her to learn responsibility and a little more organization. Also as a parent I feel at ease knowing I can check on her whenever we’re part.

Review.Titre: The TickTalk4 is great for parents…
Review.Contenu: The TickTalk4 is great for parents needing a device that gives you access to your kids. Parents have total control and supervision of the watch. My son loves it. He is very comfortable wearing it all day. My only concern about the Tick Talk4 is that the location of the watch tends to get off. When we are home, it always has his location across the street from our home. That’s the only thing I would love to see updated.

Overall, this is a great watch.  We love it, but there are some things I hope improve.Positives:+Great Price Point+Very Durable+Dual Camera+Daughter loves itNegative:-Not a lot to do with app.  I would like to see a digi pet or something fun.-Sometimes the watch disconnects for wifi/data.  The watch still works and you can call, but sending pictures and video gets difficult.-Interface is effective, but not inspiring.  I could use some more "wow" in the design.

We purchased a TickTalk 4 watch for our daughter. It allows us to communicate with her when she is out of the house and we need to arrange where to pick up from school, when she needs to come home from a friend's house, and know where she is if we haven't heard from her. RedPocket is a decent cell service for a reasonable price.Pros:- Decent call quality- Limit phone calls to/from known contacts- Prevents text messages from unknown contacts and sends them to Admin phone (parent)- Useful shortcuts to call mom/dad- Recorded voice messages are very usefulCons:- Will not let you type a text message - must be transcribed voice-to-text- Will not let you face time on data- Does not use phone plan "text message" allotment for sending texts - that uses data- Requires data to provide GPS (we use a not-unlimited RedPocket plan, so when data runs out, you can't know where the watch is until the new billing cycle)- Limited emojis/stickers for text messaging- Touch screen is somewhat difficult to use and not very responsive around the edges

Review.Titre: Great Option to Replace Cell Phones
Review.Contenu: We received the watch but it was delivered without the requested SIM card. We contacted customer service and they were able to ship it out the same day. We received it within 2 days. The setup has been a little tricky but over all not bad. I am really hoping the functionality is as good as I feel like it will be. We will update again once we are really into our 30 day window. I have had to call customer service twice & have been pleasantly surprised. So far we are happy with this purchase.

Our son loves his watch. We got the black one so it resembles a military, police officer type watch look. It has been extremely useful to call and talk to him and vice versa. We had 1 issue with it tracking him. It said he was stillOn our street when he was actually at school. But it corrected itself. We decided on this watch brand because in the future I want to be able to send him reminders and things.

Review.Titre: This watch has been great for my son
Review.Contenu: This watch has been great for my son.  He's able to text me or call anyone he wants with no issues.  The battery doesn't last as long as I'd like but it works for his purposes.  Customer service has been exactly what I could ask for.   When I had difficulties they have been responsive and assisted with all issues I could ask for.

Review.Titre: Solid watch for an 8 year old
Review.Contenu: I was looking for a watch for my 8 year old son. He spends most of his time outside with his buddies running through the neighborhood. The ticktalk watch has been a perfect fit for him. It has all the security I was looking for. I have the ability to block outside calls and set his contacts. The watch has a GPS tracker so I know where he’s at in the neighborhood and a bunch of fun features for him to play with. The only knock I would have is its durability, but that could be my sons fault. The customer service team has been great so it’s not really an issue.

My son LOVES to run around and away from us. No matter how often we tell him to stay close by, he always gets excited and just runs off. We got this watch as a way to be able to keep track of him and also be and to reach him. This watch has been a game changer and has reduced my anxiety 10-fold. The sound quality of the calls are excellent, I like how we can control everything through the app, and my son can take pics and texts us whenever his watch is active. The only reason for 4 stars is that the watch is a bit bulky and broke within 4 months of use. My son is 7, and I don't think he is the most responsible with his watch, but at the same time I don't think he was intentionally rough with the watch for it to break so soon. However, customer service has been extremely helpful and are working to help us resolve the issue.

Review.Titre: 4 stars for the watch, 5 for the service
Review.Contenu: For the watch, I will give 4 stars. It has met our expectations and done the job we wanted it to.We gave this to my elementary school aged son. As parents, we like that we can keep in touch with him easily and can see his location if there are any concerns. Being strapped to his wrist, there is lower risk of losing it compared to a smartphone.The watch is not as full featured as an Apple or Android smart watch, but it's appropriate for this age group. It is also rugged and the watch itself has withstood the rigors of an active 10 year old. I recommend purchasing the screen protector to mitigate scratching to the watch face itself.My son enjoyed the additional independence the watch afforded, and particularly enjoyed taking pictures on the built-in camera.The reasons why I'd not give the watch 5 stars are that the strap broke (I see other reviewers had the same issue), and backups are not automatic. We lost my son's pictures due to the watch failing to power on right around the time I was sending it in for the strap issue. I was advised that we should run the backup weekly or so to avoid this in the future.Tiffiny has been great to work with as we navigated the warranty process for addressing the broken strap and non-powering watch issues. She has responded promptly to my questions and has come to a fair resolution. Sometimes devices break, and it's frustrating, but having effective customer service smooths over those issues.

Review.Titre: My kid still gets phone calls that go…
Review.Contenu: My kid gets phone calls that go through to his watch from unapproved numbers. Got an answer from ticktalk the same day, changed the settings, hopefully it works!
We have very pleased with basic functions such as texting, voice calls and location tracking. My son loves the music and the activity tracker as well.

I love the product. By far the best watch without games and internet. My only complaint is that the tick talk 4 is not waterproof and it is extremely bulky. Geo fencing alerts would be nice but not a must have since the gps tracking is accurate.

We received the watch Friday night. Packaging is nice.Setup: setup is easy and great instructions on getting started were provided. We used the SIM card that came with the watch and it was cheap to add a line. The one thing that was frustrating is we were unable to complete setup because the watch kept saying deactivated. Because it was the weekend we were unable to fix it with customer service. Monday I did the live chat and they quickly activated it. Natasha did a great job with customer service. Setup on the app is easy and I like the parental controls. Functionality: my child loves the watch, he thinks it’s so cool. Messages work well but I wish that the messages would go straight to my phone instead of the app but I understand the security reasons. It would be nice if the app notification on my phone gave me a preview of the message. GPS works well to see where he is at. Overall we are pleased with the TickTalk 4 watch so far and look forward to using it more.

Review.Titre: As someone who is not technologically…
Review.Contenu: As someone who is not technologically advanced, it was mostly simple to set up, and when I did have trouble, customer service was a quick 1 minute call away to help.   👍

My kids got tick talk watches for Christmas, so far they work great. Battery life could be a bit longer. Everything “fun” about the watches will drain the battery quicker. Video calls are limited to 3 minutes and will automatically end. But I wanted the watches for peace of mind and they serve that purpose well. I can track their location, and I can contact them at all times.

Review.Titre: The phone is everything we wanted so…
Review.Contenu: The phone is everything we wanted so far. Basic phone service, no games, gps tracking.Hardest part was understanding the phone plan setup. But in the end it's actually easy and I made it harder than I should have.

Review.Titre: Product is great and very user…
Review.Contenu: Product is great and very user friendly. It took us time to get all the right settings in place but overall it does the job. Wished we could customize the do not disturb or school profile options to keep some reminders on. Kids is happy!

We have been happy with the tilk talk 3 watch.  We have had some issues but the customer service has been awesome.  They respond quickly and have solutions.  My daughter loves her watch and uses it frequently.  It gives me peace of mind when she is out with her friends or baby sitting.

Review.Titre: I got this watch for my son and it’s…
Review.Contenu: I got this watch for my son and it’s definitely worth it! As a worried mother having my child in school Its given me some sort of peace! Super easy to use with the app. I do wish there was a way to change the language though, just like a phone. Other than that its been great!

Quick delivery, easy set up, easy to use.  I liked the camera and it was easy to set up others to be able to call the watch. The unit itself is a bit big, the battery life is so-so, and the watchband can't be replaced so when it brakes, you need to get a new watch.  Overall, we have liked it as it has worked well.

Review.Titre: Good starter "smart watch" with nice features for parents
Review.Contenu: My son has had his tick talk watch for almost a month now. He loves it and thinks it's cool. He likes the music app (buy the headphones or you will regret it!!!) So far, my favorite features are GPS and drop ins. GPS seems to be pretty accurate though it would be nice if I didn't have to reopen the app to see when location changes. We have used the face feature several times and it almost always works great. I wish it stayed on longer then 3 minutes though. Oh! I forgot about reminders - I set daily reminders to keep him I'm schedule while I'm working. I love that part tooBefore ordering, I was hesitant about the size of the watch. I promise it's not as big as it looks online. It fits my 10 year olds arm just fine.I went with 4 stars instead of 5 just because the band/attachment broke after less then a month of use. According to my son, he didn't do anything to break it (granted he doesn't always tell the truth). However, as a product made for kids it, should be able to handle wear and tear pretty well.

Review.Titre: Great investment for family with kids
Review.Contenu: I got the Tick Talk watches for my twins.  I feel a lot more at ease with the kids wearing them.  It's nice to be able to communicate with them and them with me when needed.  Customer service is also really great.  Setting up the first one took me a bit of time and the 2nd one was easy. Lots of good features and I like that there’s no games or apps on here aside from camera, group and single texting options and different themes for the home screen and app display which are cool, colorful and fun. They have gotten lots of compliments on them and when we explain to them how it works, it’s even more impressive. It was easy to add family members and a few friends. But I learned that in order for family members to contact the watch, they must have the TickTalk app on their phone as well. I’m sure it’s simple enough to set up.  The only issue I have been having is when my kids are in school, they don't always show the accurate location.  My daughter was in Hawaii the other day according to her watch. I am not sure what is causing this however, I still think these watches are a great investment. Also, the reception in one of the kids classrooms isn’t that great so it’s constantly searching for a connection and draining the battery😏.  You can't put a price on your child's safety so I am happy to know, that we can communicate and I would definitely recommend this to family’s with young children as an alternative option to cellphones.

Review.Titre: Overall I'm pretty happy with my tick…
Review.Contenu: Overall I'm pretty happy with my tick talk 4. The GPS tracking seems to be off every once in awhile so that's really my only complaint. My daughter has been able to call and text me when she needs and that gives me peace of mind.
It would be helpful if you set up cancellation process to be automatic. It would show the customer that you are confident about the service.

Review.Titre: Great ordering experience and clear set…
Review.Contenu: Great ordering experience and clear set up directions.  All my questions were addressed and answered very quickly and fully.

Review.Titre: I was trying to decide between the…
Review.Contenu: I was trying to decide between the Gizmo 2 and the SyncUp at first however the reviews on those watches were not great.  Most reviews stated bad call quality and spotty GPS which are the main purpose of kids GPS watches, so I was a bit disappointed.  That led me to do some research on other options and I am glad I did.  TickTalk is different as you do not used a typical watch line addon via your cellular service, it uses a full cell phone connection line, which TickTalk offers for the same price as it would have been to add on a watch line to my cellular plan.  The reason for this is that this uses more data than the other guys and this leads to a more stable connection, better gps and clearer voice calls.  This also allows the watch to do video calls which is very cool.  The watch has of great features that include 2 cameras (my son loves this), the ability for an adult to lock the phone to just a clock screen via the app during school hours if you want (I love this), and ingoing/outgoing calls only to approved people who have downloaded the ticktalk app. I gave it 4 stars as there 2 drawbacks in my opinion, the size of the watch and its not waterproof.  The watch is big so if you have a child with a smaller wrist this might be an issue.  The watch only has a IP67 rating so it will be ok if it gets wet for a short time but swimming/showering with the watch is not recommended.  I would definately recommend this over the other main GPS watches for kids due to better overall call quality and better GPS stability for tracking.

Review.Titre: Awesome for a one of a kind watch
Review.Contenu: We researched a bunch of different kids watches. This was the only watch that had everything we wanted. I'm able to call, text, video call even and she's able to do the same. This watch even has voice to text capabilities so you don't just have the preset texts which is amazing. I did get the prepaid T-Mobile sim with the purchase, but decided to just add it to your T-Mobile account as another line instead. So far I feel like the watch is well worth it. My kid loves the I heart music feature and we bought Bluetooth headphones that she can listen and make phone calls on. The music feature seems to cut out a lot and visit extremely clear, but hey this is just an extra feature,but definitely one reason she wanted this one. We did have an issue with the GPS showing her several miles away from where we were, watch in my hand. I don't know why it showed her being somewhere we had never taken the watch, as we had just said it up a couple of hours before. I tried to update the GPS and did the live tracking feature and it still said she was in that spot, but after I rebooted it, it finally updated the GPS to the correct location.That is a major concern to me because that is one of the main reasons I bought this watch, so that I could know where she is at all times. If the GPS is off by several miles, that's a problem. An exact location off by just a few blocks is expected, but not that far off. We just set the watch up yesterday, so hopefully it won't do that again and we will have better luck with the GPS for the future. Overall I'm very happy with this purchase as long as the GPS works correctly and I'm considering getting more for my other children.

Review.Titre: Was trying to decide between the Gizmo…
Review.Contenu: Was trying to decide between the Gizmo and SyncUp watches for my 8 year old.  The reviews on those watches were not great with the main issue being spotty GPS and bad call quality.  As those are the main purpose for the watch I kept searching to see if a better alternative was available.  The best reviews on a kids watch was for the TickTalk and after getting the watch I can see why.  The watch provides a much more stable and  clear connection than my sons friends watch which is because you have to get a full cellular plan on this phone.  TickTalk offers the cellular plan for the price of what a watch plan would cost me with my cell provider.  I ordered the watch directly from TickTalk as they were running a good sale and as I wanted to talk to customer service as I had questions about the features and connection requirements.  I talked directly to a person!  Not a voice command service, which drives me nuts, and the service representative was very helpful as well as very polite.  Love when you can speak with someone in customer service who knows what they are talking about.  The watch has great features with 2 cameras, incoming/outgoing calls to only approved contacts who have to have the TickTalk app and be approved by a parent, and the ability to lock the phone via the parent app to a watch face which is very useful during school hours! The only cons I have noted is the size, this is a large watch, bigger than my smart watch and it is only IP67 rated which hopefully will not be an issue if my child remembers to take it off before swimming.  These 2 cons are the reason I gave this 4 stars instead of 5.  IMO this is a best GPS tracking watch available right now for kids.Thanks TickTalk

Update: customer service is very responsive as can be seen here in the reply. I'm adding one more star in return.3 stars given the cons.Cons:1. Too bulky. I knew it was the bulkiest out of them (Gabb watch 2/3 as bulky). But I decided to go with it because of the pros. 2. Extremely poor documentation. The little paper that came with the watch doesn't explain the most basic thing about the watch: what do the 2 silver and red buttons do? How to get to the settings screen on the watch (you're supposed to swipe left a few times)? How to put the sim card in?3. Poor Q&A from untrained support. I asked what the red button do, support answered "look at this youtube video" which doesn't even talk about the button at all. When I told them the video was not helpful and a waste of my time, there was no apology. Only then did they give me the answer they should have given in the first place.4. Price is the steepest, which would be fine if documentation and support was a bit better.Pros:1. The software and hardware is pretty good. Call quality good. Interface good (once you know to swipe left to access other screens!)2. Location service accurate.3. Affordable service plan.

Review.Titre: Good option for in case of emergencies
Review.Contenu: Tricky to set up if you're not tech savvy. But I called the helpline and they walked me through it. My kid loves the watch and we like being able to contact her in case of emergency.

Review.Titre: This is my first time using Ticktalk 4
Review.Contenu: This is my first time using Ticktalk 4, the watch very nice and has the features and kids safety parents need, the only down side is the location tracking is not accurate it always showing my kids miles away from their actual location.

Review.Titre: Fast shipping easy set up it’s not…
Review.Contenu: Fast shipping easy set up it’s not perfect but I don’t regret my purchase!
The product is working as described. It was easy to set it up. The phone app looks a bit dated and could use an upgrade. Overall, my daughter loves her watch!
Overall a good device. The location services are a little slow and showed my son in China for a few days which was really strange.

I bought this watch for my 6 year-old son in June 2022, because we both had anxiety about him starting day camp with weekly field trips.  I loved the tracking, text, and voice/video features of this watch…so I purchased one.The watch is bulky; however, the features are awesome and intuitive…when they work.  A minor issue is that the gps isn’t always accurate, but with a refresh or two…it corrects itself. The first time this happened, I panicked, because it appeared my son was in a neighborhood near his day camp…instead of at camp.  He was actually safe and sound at camp though.  My biggest issue, is that the watch stopped working spontaneously 3 separate times in a 2 month period, for no explicable reason. The screen would go dark, and then we’d get a blue screen...lasting a day or two. Some of the features may or may not work during that time.  Like, I could call…and it would ring, but he couldn’t answer.  There were no icons displayed. The most disturbing incident was when my son tried to call me, and the watch stopped working as he was trying to call.  Because we were abruptly disconnected…I stopped what I was doing and drove to his camp location. He was in tears, and the staff was concerned, because they’d never seen him so emotional.  He told me he needed me and couldn’t reach me.  I’m glad he was in a safe environment when it happened…but it made us question the reliability of the watch.   We kept wearing the watch, but it happened two additional times. Once…while he was at home with me, shortly after putting the watch on.  We were preparing to leave the house. He looked down…and it was the blue screen of inoperability again. That is the last time we used it.Customer service responded quickly.  Sent us a shipping label for us to return it. It took me a while to send it back, because my son left his portable charger a a family members home…and we couldn’t find it for the return. Once we found it, it was still within the warranty period, so I returned it. They sent the same watch back with new chargers…saying they couldn’t replicate the charging issue (that I never reported nor had an issue with). When I informed them that there was never a charging issue…they then said they couldn’t identify a problem, but they updated the operating system.  Hopefully the watch doesn’t have an issue again, because the warranty period is coming to an end.  I can only assume this is a defect of the product…because they did not replace the watch, and my only experience has been problematic.  Because of this, I do not recommend this product. It has not been reliable. I’d have recommended it had it functioned properly consistently. I’m still working with customer service (as they remain responsive) to remedy this issue.  I will update my review if there are any changes.Update: There is a lifetime warranty on hardware defects.  So I have increased my rating from 2 stars to 4 stars.  Hopefully with the OS update, there will he no more issues with the watch.

Review.Titre: My son's watch broke and they are…
Review.Contenu: My son's watch broke and they are sending a replacement

Review.Titre: I bought it for my 5 yo son last year
Review.Contenu: I bought it for my 5 yo son last year. We love it! It’s easy for him to use and I feel very safe with track/Call system!!

Review.Titre: Solid smart watch for a child
Review.Contenu: Solid smart watch for a child.  My 10yr old loves it.  Wishes it had games but nice that it does not.  I do wish the app integration for contacts did not have to pair with the watch for each contact.  My mom lives a few hours away and it is a shame she cannot video chat with my son today, on his birthday.  It seems logical for a parent to approve a contact and connect them to the phone manually in some way.

Review.Titre: This watch is actually pretty cool
Review.Contenu: This watch is actually pretty cool. It does all the things and only the things I want my 8 year old to be able to do with a smart watch. Setting up was not the easiest, and I do wish it came with clearer instructions. We are still figuring some things out. Also, the speaker isn’t great and I would recommend the head phones so you can hear your kiddo.

We are one our first week of having TickTalk and so far we are happy with it. I will say that the location service is generalized, and it takes a little bit to update sometimes, which is the reason for 4 stars instead of 5. However, I am very happy that we are able to communicate with our 6 year old in a safe way. This watch gives us peace of mind, even when in Do Not Disturb mode he could make an emergency call to us.

Review.Titre: The service rep was great but I am…
Review.Contenu: The service rep was great but I am upset overall because when purchasing the two TickTalk 4's for our son and daughter, I did not see any mention at all for an available extended warranty.  Had I seen it, I would have purchased them as well at the time of original purchase.

Good so far. Hopefully we never have to use the emergency feature but it is good to have the SOS options and the GPS seems to work well enough. Not 5 stars because the facetalk only works if the phone is on a wifi connection. Also the water resistance is only good the watch is not submerged so your child will have to remove the watch if they happen to have swim class at school or need to use showers for a sport. Functions work well and set up is not too bad to follow.

Quite good product so far. My daughter like the watch. She enjoys calling us on phone and video and we really appreciate the trackability. She also loves the music playing feature. She was missing playing games, but we actually didn't want the watch to distract her at home or school.

My son and I love this watch and all of the different features on it.  Since he can call and text with our immediate family I feel as though this is a good alternative to getting him a phone at a young age. However, I mainly purchased this so that I could track him walking home from school.  Unfortunately the gps lags so it takes a good 30-60 seconds to update his location.  I was wanting something that continually tracks him instead.  This is why I gave the watch 4 starts and not 5.

Review.Titre: I ordered this for my kids since they…
Review.Contenu: I ordered this for my kids since they were going to summer camp - I wanted them to be safe, to know where they were at all times, and to be able to contact me. This hit all the marks, as they aren’t old enough for a phone. The only reason I give 4 stars is that the GPS isn’t accurate. I even looked up AT&T versus T-Mobile coverage in my area, and went with ATT since it was shown to be better in my area - but the GPS is always a bit off.

Review.Titre: Watch works great and love all the…
Review.Contenu: Watch works great and love all the features, I do wish that it could type text and not preset messages and it would be nice if video call lasted longer but I understand reason why the watch does get hot when being used.

The tick talk 4 seems to be a big improvement from the 3. I do worry about the screen breaking because the corners are not as protected as each of the sides. The app definitely needs improvement in it's engineering. It logs me out constantly and so the messages from my kids don't come through until I log back in.

When I purchased the watch, it was not updating the location properly. I opened up a ticket with the support team. They are diligent in solving my issue. While the ticket is still open, I can say my child loves the watch and I like all the features as well. One thing I would like to see added is the ability to view text messages from allowed contacts/friends in the app. I can only see what was blocked.

We recently ordered this item for my 11 year old son. I compared it to other options and felt like this gave the most functionality for the best monthly price. Set up was easy, customer service has been great so far, the app is simple, and it works really well (sound quality, service, GPS, alarms and calendars). So far I am happy. The only thing that I don't like is that if you want to text you have to use the app. It's not terrible, but it makes it so that friends with other similar devices won't be able to message him, but they can at least call each other. That is the reason behind my rating of 4 stars.

So far so good. Had to contact support a couple of times at the beginning but was able to get the issue figured out. Wish I could text my son without going through the app but I guess I knew ahead of time that that’s how it works. Location is always accurate, phone works and he’s figured the settings so we’re happy

We have twin girls and there are some custody issues and needless to say some fears and needs to facilitate communication. We had Gizmos, but the app was so limiting and very few numbers allowed and the gps rarely updated and they don’t call 911. The TickTalk watches are amazing. They can call 911 and 50 numbers. The app allows more interaction. The kids can FaceTime. There is a I heart radio connection with kid friendly stations. The only problem is that the watch is a little bulky, but girls don’t care, they love it!
We love this device! It’s the perfect alternative to buying your kid a phone. We are still learning all the functions on it but we got the basics and it’s really all you need.

This is a great watch. I compared many other watches to this one and nothing comes close. The only reason I gave it 4 starts instead of 5 is because of the gps accuracy. It’s close, but not 100%. It also doesn’t have geofencing like many of the others. I do think it’s bulky, but my son has never complained and likes to wear it. So it’s a win! I do not regret purchasing this watch.

Great product.  We have struggled with it not staying connected to the internet, but other than that, we love it.  I highly recommend the watch to parents.  My son says it is comfortable to wear, and forgets he has it on sometimes.  It gives us a way to communicate with him when he is at summer camp, or away from us without the worry of him having a phone.  This product fit our needs perfectly.

Review.Titre: The battery life needs more testing but…
Review.Contenu: The battery life needs more testing but right now it seems it may not live up to what support advised would be 5 hours of talk time on a full charge. That said, the emergency features are what we wanted and seem to work without issue so far.

Review.Titre: I love the all of the features of this…
Review.Contenu: I love the all of the features of this watch! I haven't had the full 30 day experience but $10 a month this purchase has definitely provided me with peace of mind knowing that I can get in contact with my little one.

Got the TickTalk 4 for my child. I liked that it had no games on it. Overall we like the watch. Two issues lower the rating in my mind. First, the watch would not initially charge and I had to email the company to find out how to get it to begin charging. It involved plugging and unplugging the watch 10 times. The email response was swift but this information is not available online in the FAQs. Second, the GPS is not as precise as other devices we have that use GPS, it is off by about a half city block.

The MyTickTalk site had all the info on the latest TickTalk 4 laid out in a fun and easy way to consume. I ordered a watch for my 3rd grade daughter going on her first field trip post pandemic without her mom as a chaperone. She was nervous...they both were. The watch came through with accurate location at any time. The remote answer is awesome and pics up sounds clearly. Hope to see geofencing and full waterproof added soon. Loving the watch! All her friends are asking their parents for one!

Review.Titre: Almost perfect! Hope to add one more feature in the future
Review.Contenu: Thank you for making such a wonderful tracking watch. Product and app is high quality. My only concern is that I hope there is at least one or two games available in the watch to give my toddler incentive to wear it. For the parents, all the features are perfect. But for the toddler he/she doesn't have much incentive to wear an oversized watch.Hope there will be a software update in the future for this, that will make it perfect!

My son has been using the watch for 2 weeks and it does everything as advertised.  The app is easy to use and can provide a lot of detail if needed.  Th only minor complaint is battery life, would be great if a charge lasted more than 3 days with light use (voice/text - no streaming or video).  Looks like its 2 days at this point.

We were upset when we went into AT&T and they were trying to sell us an apple watch as our only option for our 7 year old.  They said they have no kid friendly watch and when others tried getting them elsewhere they couldn't connect it.  We were lucky a friend recommended this watch to us as her son uses it and has AT&T also.  It works great!  We love it for our son and it was easy to add him onto our plan.

Tiffiny Adams, I'll say it again for those in the back, Ms. Adams, is the best thing since canned beer and sliced bread. I called the 1-800.. And didn't have to wait for an automated voicemail, I connected right to a representative, in which it was Tiffiny, she was super helpful in regards to the incident in which I was having and offering a solution to the problem. 100/10 would recommend.The watch, I love it, because I have peace of mind with my son, knowing where he is, and he can communicate without the additional toxicity of being exposed to the internet. I've had no issues with the watch, it's extremely dependable.

My son just turned 6 and recently started school.  It was a big step trusting him with people we don't know personally.  Being able to track him and contact him if we need to and him being able to contact us has been a huge relief.  We love it!
Natasha walked me through what I needed to do, this included troubleshooting - she kept me informed, was very kind and assisted in replacing the unit. Thank you!!!

Review.Titre: User friendly app and VERY accurate location service
Review.Contenu: The ticktalk app is very user friendly and the location function is extremely accurate. We used another watch that came with a terrible app that told us my daughter was in China half the time. Ticktalk is definitely worth the extra cost. The best part is you can use almost any service you choose so you aren't forced to pay for an expensive phone plan. I wish the watch was not quite as bulky but I believe it is best for kids to have a well protected watch while they are outside playing. This company has excellent customer service and I will continue to recommend this product to friends.
Shipping was very quick.  We had a little trouble figuring out how to set up text messages, but our granddaughter loves her new watch/birthday present.

Review.Titre: Tick talk watch is a great watch I…

Review.Titre: Great response from Tiffany in customer…
Review.Contenu: Great response from Tiffany in customer service.  Was able to get a replacement watch for the one my son lost.
Super easy to purchase.  It’s a Christmas present so I can’t comment on anything else now.

Review.Titre: Overall its a great kids watch
Review.Contenu: Overall its a great kids watch. I only wish it had flashlight, it was waterproof and had a glow-when-light falls on it band for kids safety when going out at night.

Thanks to TickTalk watch, I am able to see when the school bus arrives as the school bus app is not working and it’s been running late recently. With the watch, I don’t have to wait at the bus stop for a long time until the bus comes.

Review.Titre: My son loves this and I have to point…
Review.Contenu: My son loves this and I have to point out it is the easiest set up ever!

Review.Titre: Tick Talk is a great watch for kids . 6 months on and working perfectly.

Review.Titre: The TickTalk watch and service is great

It’s been very reliable! Unfortunately, it was almost destroyed by a dog at a friend’s house. Thankfully, Tiffany Adams in the customer service department has been very helpful and efficient in helping us get a replacement. We’ve had no problems with the watch or the company. Thank you!

A few months ago I decided to give my self a little peace of mind and purchase multiple TickTalk watches for my three littles. I have nothing but great things to say about them. The location is always accurate, the service is wonderful and my kids say they are super comfortable. I had the pleasure of speaking with Tiffiny in customer service and she was beyond helpful! Thank you all for everything you do to help out babies in this crazy world!
